promellere: <entryFree id="n38759" type="gloss" key="promelle^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">promellĕre</orth>, <itype>litem promovere</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=252" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 252</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
promenervat: <entryFree id="n38760" type="gloss" key="promenervat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">promenervat</orth> <itype>item</itype> (in Saliari carmine) pro monet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=205" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 205</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
promercalis: <entryFree id="n38761" type="main" key="pro_merca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-mercālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>merx</etym>, <sense id="n38761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is dealt in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is bought and sold</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:13:11:1:34" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 13, 11, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 54</bibl></cit>; Gell 4, 1, 23.</sense></entryFree>
promercium: <entryFree id="n38762" type="main" key="pro_merci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-mercĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traffic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merchandise</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:3:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 3, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:41 al" default="NO">30, 1, 41 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
promereo: <entryFree id="n38763" type="main" key="pro_me^re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-mĕrĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-mĕrĕor</orth>, <itype>ĭtus, 2</itype>, <sense id="n38763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38763.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To deserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be deserving of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merit</hi>, in a good or bad sense (class.) </sense><sense id="n38763.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">retineri nequeo, quin dicam ea, quae promeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mali sum promeritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita velim me promerentem ames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus levius punitus quam sit ille promeritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv 2, 28, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:63" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 63</bibl></cit>.—In a good sense: <cit><quote lang="la">promeruisti, ut ne quid ores, quin impetres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promerenti optime hoccine pretii redditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">deorum indulgentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:74:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 74, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium voluntatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 1</bibl></cit> dies qui primus videre Promeruit nasci mundum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 5, 318</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38763.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to deserve</hi> of one any thing (good or bad); constr. usu. with <hi rend="ital">de</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, rarely with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam referre gratiam possum satis, proinde ut tu promeritus de me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paratiores erunt ad bene de multis promerendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off 2, 15, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38763.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">win</hi> homines tenues unum habent in nostrum ordinem aut promerendi aut proferendi beneficii losum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 34, 70</bibl> socios, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">principem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:62" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te numquam negabo Promeritam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per hostias deos laevos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to render favorable</tr>, <tr>to propitiate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 229</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">talibus enim hostiis promeretur Deus,</quote> <trans><tr>is won</tr>, <tr>conciliated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 13, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-mĕrĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <hi rend="ital">n</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desert</hi> (good or evil), <hi rend="ital">merit.</hi>—In good sense, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 307, 10</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 79 Rib.); Lucr 2, 651; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Red. ad Quir. 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F 4, 394</bibl>.—In bad sense, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 49</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 90.</sense></entryFree>
prometheus: <entryFree id="n38764" type="main" key="Pro^me_theus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏmētheus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, =<foreign lang="greek">*promhqeu/s</foreign> (the Forethinker), <sense id="n38764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Iapetus and Clymene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Epimetheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Deucalion.</hi> He formed men of clay, and animated them by means of fire brought from heaven; <cit><quote lang="la">for which he was fastened to Caucasus, where a vulture, or, as some say, an eagle, fed upon his entrails, until, at last, it was slain by Hercules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:31:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 31, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 54" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:144" default="NO">144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3, 29</bibl> (4, 4, 7); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:85:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 85, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:478" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 478</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 10, 5</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., of a skilful potter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:133" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 133</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n38764.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏmēthēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Prometheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Promethean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Caucasus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:12:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 12, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:46:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fibra,</quote> <trans><tr>of Prometheus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:356" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creta, Col. poët. 10, 59: lutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:39:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 39, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:305" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 305</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38764.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏmēthĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <hi rend="ital">patron.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Prometheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Deucalion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 390</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
promico: <entryFree id="n38765" type="main" key="pro_mi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-mĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n38765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38765.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gleam forth;</hi> transf., <hi rend="ital">to spring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">start forth</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">promicant molles plumulae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>grow out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 138, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 253, 9: lacrimae, <hi rend="ital">burst</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gush forth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl>, p. 133, 40.—</sense><sense id="n38765.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to throw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliver with vehemence</hi>: orationem, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 65, 6</bibl> (promicare extendere et porro jacere, Non.).</sense></entryFree>
prominens: <entryFree id="n38766" type="main" key="pro_mi^nens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from promineo.</entryFree>
prominenter: <entryFree id="n38767" type="main" key="pro_mi^nenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmĭnenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. promineo, <sense id="n38767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
prominentia: <entryFree id="n38768" type="main" key="pro_mi^nenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmĭnentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prominens</etym>, <sense id="n38768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jutting out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prominence</hi> (postAug.):<cb n="PROM" />  ita uti summam habeant prominentiam (anterides), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">praecordiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:5:50" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 5, 50</bibl></cit>; in <number>plur.</number> of <hi rend="ital">promontories</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
promineo: <entryFree id="n38769" type="main" key="pro_mi_ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-mīnĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">jut out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be prominent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overhang</hi>, <hi rend="ital">project</hi> (not in Cic.; cf. Moser ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:7, p. 352" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 7, p. 352</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> syn.: exsto, emineo). </sense><sense id="n38769.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phaselis prominet penitus in altum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis prominens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pontum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:778" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 778</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma prominet in vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:845" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 845</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante frontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursis ungues prominent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (dentes elephantorum) prominent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 62, § 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorum coma gelido prominet Algido, Hor C. 1, 21, 6: cum promineret ore, quantum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Epod. 5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:30" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 30</bibl>: matres familiae pectore nudo prominentes, <hi rend="ital">bending forward</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 47, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38769.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to reach out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi> to any thing, <hi rend="ital">come forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (justitia) nec sibi tantum conciliata sit nec occulta, sed foras tota promineat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:7:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxima pars ejus (gloriae) in memoriam ac posteritatem promineat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 43, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">prominent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 53, § 141</bibl></cit>: figurae signorum, Vitr 6, 2.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prominentiore caudā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a prominent part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in prominenti litoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 53</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prominentia montium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmĭnenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a prominent manner.—Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prominentius a lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:11:90" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 11, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:4:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 2, 4, 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
promino: <entryFree id="n38770" type="hapax" key="pro_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-mĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive forward</hi> or <hi rend="ital">along</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta ad lacum bibendi causā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 229, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prominulus: <entryFree id="n38771" type="main" key="pro_mi^nu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmĭnŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>promineo</etym>, <sense id="n38771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">projecting a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather prominent</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">venter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mammae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 261</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
promiscam: <entryFree id="n38772" type="main" key="pro_miscam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmiscam</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prōmiscē</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-miscŭē</orth>, <sense id="n38772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. promiscuus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, A., B., and C.</sense></entryFree>
promiscus: <entryFree id="n38773" type="main" key="pro_miscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmiscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. promiscuus <sense id="n38773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
promiscuus: <entryFree id="n38774" type="main" key="pro_miscu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-miscŭus</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmis-cŭs</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:16:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 16, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:13:4" default="NO">16, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 13, 7</bibl>; prob. also ante-class.; v. below the <pos>adv.</pos> promiscam), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>misceo</etym>. <sense id="n38774.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">mixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not separate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">distinct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without distinction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indiscriminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promiscuous</hi> (as <pos>adj.</pos> not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">opera promiscua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 138</bibl></cit>: conubia, i. e. <hi rend="ital">between patricians and plebeians</hi>, Liv 4, 2; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum promiscuum patribus ac plebi facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 21</bibl></cit>. multitudo, <hi rend="ital">of patricians and plebeians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 12, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promiscua omnium generum caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepultura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum,</quote> <trans><tr>to which all are admitted without distinction</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divina atque humana promiscua habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatae et promiscuae copiae,</quote> <trans><tr>common</tr>, <tr>general</tr>, <tr>public</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promiscuos feminarum concubitus permittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">muta ista et inanima (sc. tecta) intercidere ac reparari promiscua sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>may be destroyed and restored again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 84 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in promiscuo licentiam atque improbitatem esse voluit,</quote> <trans><tr>to be universal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:44" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:51" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec arma in promiscuo, sed clausa sub custode,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in every man's hands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38774.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in gram., <hi rend="ital">epicene</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">promiscuum nomen, i. e. epicoenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38774.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usual</hi> (very rare and not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">promiscua ac vilia mercari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varia promiscaque cogitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:16:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 16, 8</bibl></cit> (al. promiscua): <cit><quote lang="la">opinionis tam promiscae errores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:13:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in three forms. </sense><sense id="n38774.3" n="A" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmiscam</orth> (<case>acc.</case> form from promiscus), <hi rend="ital">in common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indiscriminately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promiscuously</hi> (ante-class.): promiscam dicebant pro promiscue, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=224" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 224</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut meā laetitiā laetus promiscam siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: cetera promiscam voluit communia haberi, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 361, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38774.4" n="B" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmiscē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indiscriminately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indifferently</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 72</bibl> B. and K.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 47, 5</bibl> Weissenb.: indistincte atque promisce annotare, Gell. praef. § 2; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 3, 52: promisce atque indefinite largiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbo uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="PROM" /> </sense><sense id="n38774.5" n="C" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmiscŭē</orth> (the class. form), <hi rend="ital">in common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promiscuously</hi>: (mares et feminae) promiscue in fluminibus perluuntur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">promiscue puberes atque negotiatores interficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promiscue toto quam proprie parvā frui parte (Campi Martii) malletis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:130 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 47, § 130 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
promissio: <entryFree id="n38775" type="main" key="pro_missi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmissĭo</orth>, ōnis <gen>f.</gen> <etym>promitto</etym>. <sense id="n38775.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a promising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promise</hi> (class. only in <number>sing.</number>; prop. <hi rend="ital">the act of promising;</hi> cf. promissum, <hi rend="ital">the thing promised</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38775.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a promising</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum promissio, si audierint, probaturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:83:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 83, 339</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 53, 205</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
promissive: <entryFree id="n38776" type="main" key="pro_missi_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmissīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. promissivus <sense id="n38776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
promissivus: <entryFree id="n38777" type="main" key="pro_missi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmissīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>promitto</etym>, <sense id="n38777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">promising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promissive;</hi> in gram.; promissivum tempus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the future tense</hi>, Cons. p. 2061 P.: <cit><quote lang="la">modus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 328</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 2, 21, 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmissīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by way of promise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a promise</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
promissor: <entryFree id="n38778" type="main" key="pro_missor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmissor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promiser</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">who promises great things</hi> (very rare), Hor A. P 138; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl> Zumpt.</sense></entryFree>
promissum: <entryFree id="n38779" type="main" key="pro_missum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmissum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. promitto <sense id="n38779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
promissus: <entryFree id="n38780" type="main" key="pro_missus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from promitto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38781" type="hapax" key="pro_missus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmissus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>promitto</etym>, <sense id="n38781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promise</hi>, Manil 5, 577.</sense></entryFree>
promitto: <entryFree id="n38782" type="main" key="pro_mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-mitto</orth>, <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype> (sync. forms: <sense id="n38782.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">promisti for promisisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:110:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 110, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">promisse for promisisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:110:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 110, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; archaic <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> promittier, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 32</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n38782.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to let go forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to send</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let hang down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let grow</hi>, etc. (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): ramos vel ferro compescunt vel longius promittunt,</quote> <trans><tr>suffer to grow longer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—Reflex., <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ulla arborum avidius se promittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 44, § 107</bibl></cit>.—Of the hair, the beard, <hi rend="ital">to let hang down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let grow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis constat multos mortales capillum ac barbam promisisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 41</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pogoniae, quibus inferiore ex parte promittitur juba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 89</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Sonus lusciniae) promittitur revocato spiritu,</quote> <trans><tr>is drawn out</tr>, <tr>prolonged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 82</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia est longe et a nostris litoribus huc usque promissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, <pos>P. a.</pos>—</sense><sense id="n38782.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech. </sense><sense id="n38782.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To say beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to forebode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesy</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">praesertim cum, si mihi alterum utrum de eventu rerum promittendum esset, id futurum, quod evenit, exploratius possem promittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (di) primis minentur extis, bene promittant secundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:17:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 17, 38</bibl></cit>.—Of signs or omens, <hi rend="ital">to forebode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pari in meliora praesagio in Caesaris castris omnia aves victimaeque promiserant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:7:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promittunt omina poenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:730" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 730</bibl></cit>: clarum fore (Servium) visa circa caput flamma promiserat, Flor 1, 6, 1; 1, 7, 9.—Also, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to denote beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella ... vindemiae maturitatem promittens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 309</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38782.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To promise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to expect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give hope</hi> or <hi rend="ital">promise of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assure</hi> (class. and freq.; syn.: polliceor, spondeo, recipio), constr. with <case>acc.</case>, an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertia septem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 14, 7</bibl></cit>, dona, Ov Tr. 4, 2, 7: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> F 5, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae tibi promitto ac recipio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Neptunus quod Theseo promiserat, non fecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dii faxint, ut faciat ea quae promittit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (usu. <hi rend="ital">fut. inf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">promitto, recipio, spondeo, C. Caesarem talem semper fore civem, qualis hodie sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">promitto, in meque recipio fore eum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem inimicissimum futurum esse promitto et spondeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:41:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 41, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surrepturum pallam promisit tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 42</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">promisit Apollo Ambiguam tellure novā Salamina futuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 34</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si operam dare promittitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:prol. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. prol. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 56</bibl>: magorum vanitas ebrietati eas resistere<pb n="1465" /> <cb n="PROM" />  promittit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 124</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se remedium afferer tantamque vim morbi levaturum esse promisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit> monstrare, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">promittere oratorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to give promise of becoming</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr 4:29:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr 4, 29, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per ea scelera se parricidam,</quote> <trans><tr>excite fears lest he become</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me Promisi ultorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 96</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de alicujus voluntate promittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de me tibi sic promitto atque confirmo, me, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">promittere damni infecti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to promise indemnification for</tr>, <tr>become answerable for the possible damage</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top 4, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38782.5" n="C" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">promiserat ut daret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 21, 7</bibl></cit>.—Of things' terra ipsa promittit (aquas), <hi rend="ital">gives promise of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leads one to expect water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 27, § 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">debet extremitas (picturae) sic desinere, ut promittat alia post se,</quote> <trans><tr>to lead one to suppose</tr>, <tr>to suggest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 569" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 569</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38782.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38782.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To promise to come</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to engage one's self</hi> to meet any one, to dine, sup, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:19 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 19 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fratrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cenam mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 23, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 10</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tibi me promittere noli,</quote> <trans><tr>to expect me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 662</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38782.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To promise</hi> something to a deity, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to vow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">donum Jovi dicatum atque promissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigras pecudes Diti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:5:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 5, 33</bibl></cit>; Juv 13, 233; Petr 88; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:11:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 11, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38782.9" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To offer</hi> as a price (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pro domo sestertium millies promittens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17</bibl></cit>. 1, 1, § 3. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38782.10" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hanging down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long;</hi> of the hair: coma, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 362, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Britanni capillo sunt promisso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">capillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">barba omnibus promissa erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 41, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 4, 1</bibl>.—Of the dewlap: <cit><quote lang="la">boves palearibus amplis et paene ad genua promissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of the belly: <cit><quote lang="la">sues ventre promisso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38782.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmissum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a promise</hi> (very freq. in prose and poetry; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">promissio, pollicitatio),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 5, 53, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voto quodam et promisso teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constantia promissi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissum absolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 25, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 25, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludere aliquem promisso inani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:685" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 685</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacta et promissa servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:24:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 24, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illis promissis standum non est, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissis manere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissa firmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa fidem promissa levant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dic aliquid dignum promissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo promissa (Ennii) cadant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the expectations which he raises</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissa dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to make promises</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 239</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to fulfil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
promnion: <entryFree id="n38783" type="main" key="promnion"><orth extent="full" lang="la">promnion</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n38783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dark-colored gem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
promo: <entryFree id="n38784" type="main" key="pro_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmo</orth>, <itype>mpsi</itype> (msi), mptum (mtum), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pro-emo</etym>, <sense id="n38784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">bring out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to produce</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: profero, effero) </sense><sense id="n38784.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid tibi opus erit promptu, promito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 113</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Prompsisti tu illi vinum? <hi rend="ital">Lu.</hi> Non prompsi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam ex aerario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:84:section=195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 84, § 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa ex aerario prompta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta de narthecio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum ex armario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 21, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros inde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina dolio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:47" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptum vagina pugionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 54</bibl></cit> aliquid in usus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 16</bibl>: se, <hi rend="ital">to come forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetique cavo se robore promunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites promunt se,</quote> <trans><tr>put forth</tr>, <tr>shoot out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38784.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38784.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">draw forth</hi> est aliquid, quod non ex usu forensi...sit promendum et assumendum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 1, 14, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci, e quibus argumenta promuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc promenda tibi sunt consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promere et exercere justitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc illas promite vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 191</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38784.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to bring to light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">express</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, etc.: percuntanti promere omnia. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:48:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 48, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnificam orationem de semet ipso prompsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 90</bibl></cit>. verba, quae sensum animi nostri optime promunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8 praef.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">32: animi voluntatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 40</bibl></cit>: promere aliquid <cb n="PROM" /> loquendo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 16, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ipse sim secutus promam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: qui pueris utile carmen prompturus est, <hi rend="ital">wishes to publish</hi>, App. Flor. p 358 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">insignem attenuat deus, Obscura promens,</quote> <trans><tr>raising into notice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">promp-tus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">promtus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, prop. <hi rend="ital">brought to light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exposed to view;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n38784.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Visible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apparent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi> (rare but class.): inimicitiam atque amicitiam in frontem promptam gero, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 6</bibl> (Trag. v 8 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliud clausum in pectore, aliud promptum in linguā habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tametsi hoc minime latet, quod ita promptum et propositum est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am 40, 118</bibl></cit> prompta et aperta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eminentia et prompta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:57:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 57, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia, locos, prompta, occulta noverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil se tam clausum neque tam reconditum posse habere, quod non istius cupiditati apertissimum promptissimumque esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:20:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 20, § 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38784.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38784.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">At hand</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">prepared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prompt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclined</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disposed</hi> to or for any thing = paratus, expeditus. </sense><sense id="n38784.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudat promptos, segniores castigat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptissimus homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:17:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 17, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera, quae tibi a multis prompta esse certo scio, a me sunt paratissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem alicui promptam expositamque praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 27, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum cognoverat promptam audaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cuique promptum, arma, equos, aurum offerentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prompta et profluens eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:2:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 2, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38784.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi> (rarely <hi rend="ital">in aliquū re</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">ad bella suscipienda Gallorum aiacer et promptus est animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus ad defendendam rem publicam, Cic Fam. 3, 11, 4. esse animo prompto ad jocandum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines ad vim prompti, ad seditionem parati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agr 2, 30, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paratior ad usum forensem promptiorque esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptiores ad nostra pericula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 24, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptus ad lacessendum certamen, Liv 44, 4, 2: ad injurias vicinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 23, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptus in pavorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adulationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 61</bibl></cit>: in latrocinia, Flor 4, 12, 10; cf. in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptior in spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; and in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dalmatae in latrocinia promptissimi, Flor 4, 12, 10: celeritas prompta et parata in agendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 42, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rebus gerendis promptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38784.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">utemini nobis etiam promptioribus pro patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:59:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 59, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptus adversus insontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n38784.11" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">non promptus ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguā promptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sermone promptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptus audaciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptus animo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 58</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud quisquam manu promptior erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptior linguā quam manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 44, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptus animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 23</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli promptissimos delegebant, Sall. Fragm. ap. Arus Mess. (H. 2, 13 Dietsch): Plato veritatis omnibus exhibendae promptissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:22:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <case>dat.</case> (rare except in Tacitus): <cit><quote lang="la">promptus libertati aut ad mortem animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditioni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuicumque fiagitio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultioni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam gentem promptiorem veniae dandae fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 16, 12</bibl></cit>. —（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">promptus metuenda pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scis ipse, quam promptae superos incessere Thebae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:209" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 209</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38784.12" n="b" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">brave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courageous</hi>: maxime vellem, rem publicam in periculis a promptissumo quoque defendi, Sall. Or. Phil. cont. Lep. (H. 1, 48 Dietsch); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38784.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Easy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practicable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis et prompta defensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia haudquaquam prompta oppugnanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 29, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expugnatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus, obvia comitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptissima mortis via,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 17</bibl></cit>: promptum est, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is easy</hi>: sed nec mihi dicere promptum, Nec facere est illi, Ov M. 13, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 41</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">promptē</orth> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n38784.14" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Readily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without delay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">willingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promptly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare operam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: distribuere pecuniam <cb n="PROM" /> legatis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptius adversari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirumpere imagines (opp. cunctanter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 55</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptissime adesse alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 17, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38784.15" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Easily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptius expediam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:220" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria promptissime licentiam sumministrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
promoneo: <entryFree id="n38785" type="main" key="pro_mo^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-mŏnĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to warn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">admonish further</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi te igitur videbo et promonebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> B. and K. (dub.; al. promovebo).</sense></entryFree>
promonstra: <entryFree id="n38786" type="gloss" key="pro_monstra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmonstra</orth>, <itype>prodigia</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=224" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 224</bibl> Müll</entryFree>
promonturium: <entryFree id="n38787" type="main" key="pro_montu^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmontŭrĭum</orth>, v. promunturium.</entryFree>
promota: <entryFree id="n38788" type="main" key="pro_mo_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmōta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. promoveo, <sense id="n38788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
promotio: <entryFree id="n38789" type="main" key="pro_mo_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmōtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>promoveo</etym>, <sense id="n38789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advancement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preferment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promotion</hi> (post-class.), Lampr Anton. Diadum. 2; Firm. Math. 3, 7, 5; Ascon ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
promotus: <entryFree id="n38790" type="main" key="pro_mo_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from promoveo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38791" type="main" key="pro_mo_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmōtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>promoveo</etym>, <sense id="n38791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advancement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promotion</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Coron Mil. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
promoveo: <entryFree id="n38792" type="main" key="pro_mo_ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-mōvĕo</orth>, <itype>mōvi, mōtum</itype> (<sense id="n38792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi> promorat. Hor Epod. 11, 14: <cit><quote lang="la">promosset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Am 2, 9, 17</bibl></cit> Jahn), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to move forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">push onward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38792.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38792.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa vectibus, Caes B. C. 2, 11: onera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 23, § 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">assa in alterum apodyterii anguium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr 3, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:16" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 16</bibl></cit>: castra ad Carthaginem, <hi rend="ital">to move onward</hi>, Liv 28, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitu in Aetoliam promoto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:1:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua utrimque (in acie),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scalas et machinamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calculum,</quote> <trans><tr>to push forward</tr>, <tr>move</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:113" default="NO">11, 3, 113</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum pedem triclinio,</quote> <trans><tr>to put forth</tr>, <tr>move from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:23:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 23, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi te videbo et promovebo,</quote> <trans><tr>will take you along with me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n38792.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarge.</hi> moenia Ostia tenus, Suet Ner 16: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium, Ov P 2, 2, 72: vires in immensum orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:9:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 9, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38792.4" n="C" level="2"> Med. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to put out of joint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dislocate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">displace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in palmā quoque ossa interdum suis sedibus promoventur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 18 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femur in omnes quattuor partes promovetur, saepissime in interiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 20 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n38792.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38792.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">promovere parum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis dicat, Nihil promoveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meditatio nihil ad vitam tuendam promovens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:22:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 22, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in a lusus verbb. with movere se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in studio facundiae abunde promovisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38792.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38792.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To enlarge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>: doctrina vim promovet insitam, Hor C. 4, 4, 33; so, promovere aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prefer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promote</hi> (post-Aug.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">perduco, produco, proveho): vetus miles ad eum gradum promotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promotus ad amplissimas procurationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 31, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:90:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 90, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 3, 97</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38792.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring to light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reveal</hi>: arcana promorat loco (i. e. ex intimo corde), Hor Epod. 11, 14.—</sense><sense id="n38792.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">postpone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptias alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 28</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38792.11" n="A" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">advanced</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">late</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte promotā,</quote> <trans><tr>late at night</tr>, <tr>far into the night</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 152, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>, p. 190, 30.—</sense><sense id="n38792.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmōta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, in the lang. of the Stoics, <hi rend="ital">things that are to be preferred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pref. erable things</hi>, as being next in degree to absolute good; a literal transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">prohgme/ua</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
promptarium: <entryFree id="n38793" type="main" key="prompta_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">promptārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. promptuarius, II. B. <sense id="n38793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
prompte: <entryFree id="n38794" type="main" key="prompte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">promptē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. promo, <sense id="n38794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
promptim: <entryFree id="n38795" type="main" key="promptim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">promptim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>1. promptus</etym>, <sense id="n38795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suddenly</hi> (post-class. for the usual prompte), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. in Gen. 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
promptitudo: <entryFree id="n38796" type="main" key="prompti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">promptĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">promptitude</hi> (eccl Lat.), Fac. Defens. 3, 3.</sense></entryFree>
prompto: <entryFree id="n38797" type="main" key="prompto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prompto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>promo</etym>, <sense id="n38797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out abundantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to distribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispose of</hi> a thing (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">thesauros Jovis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be Jupiter's treasurer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum meum malum promptare malim quam peculium,</quote> <trans><tr>to have the disposal of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 61</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1466" /> <cb n="PROM" /></sense></entryFree>
promptuarium: <entryFree id="n38798" type="main" key="promptu^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">promptŭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. promptuarius, II.</entryFree>
promptuarius: <entryFree id="n38799" type="main" key="promptu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">promptŭārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">promt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>promo</etym>, <sense id="n38799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to distribution</hi> (sc. of things stored up), <hi rend="ital">distributing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arca vestiaria, armarium promptuarium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>storehouse</tr>, <tr>repository</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 309, 20</bibl></cit>; and, in comic lang., of <hi rend="ital">a prison</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38799.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">promptŭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a storeroom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repository</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promptuary</hi> (late Lat.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">horreum): e promptuario oleum profer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Cantic. 1, 20</bibl>. —In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:143:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 143, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38799.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatissimum linguae tuae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the mouth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 9:67" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 9, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promptuarium rectae rationis et orationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 212</bibl></cit> Oud.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnes quasi vetustatis promptuarium Albini memoriam laudavissent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—Collat. form (from metrical necessity), <orth extent="full" lang="la">promptārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
