promptulus: <entryFree id="n38800" type="main" key="promptu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">promptŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n38800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [1. promptus], <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prompt</hi> (late Lat.): ad loquendum promptulus, Hier. in Daniel, praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
promptus: <entryFree id="n38801" type="main" key="promptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">promptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from promo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38802" type="main" key="promptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">promptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">promtus</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>promo, prop. a taking forth; hence</etym>, <sense id="n38802.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An exposing to view</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a being visible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visibility;</hi> only in the phrase in promptu (esse, habere, ponere, etc.), <hi rend="ital">public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before the eyes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (decorum) non reconditā quādam ratione cernatur, sed sit in promptu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 27, 95</bibl></cit>; so (opp. reconditiora) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 10</bibl>; (opp. interiora) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:60:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 60, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ponere in promptu (opp. contegere atque abdere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 35, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium in promptu habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to display</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram in promptu gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in promptu scrinia Brutus habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in promptu gerunt ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: in promptu est, with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus in promptu manifestumque esse videmus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:246" default="NO" valid="yes">246</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:868" default="NO" valid="yes">868</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38802.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Readiness;</hi> only in the phrase in promptu esse, habere, <hi rend="ital">to be at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have ready</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea dicam, quae mihi sunt in promptu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in promptu habere, quantum natura hominis pecudibus antecedat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 105</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38802.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">facility;</hi> only in the phrase in promptu esse, <hi rend="ital">to be easy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Or. ad Caes. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Or. ad Caes. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedes In promptu regere est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam quae comprendere dictis In promptu mihi sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 161</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
promtus: <entryFree id="n38803" type="main" key="promtus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">promtus</orth>, = promptus, v. promo, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, and 2. promptus.</entryFree>
promulcum: <entryFree id="n38804" type="gloss" key="promulcum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">promulcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n38804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tow-rope</hi>: promulco agi dicitur navis, cum scaphae ducitur fune, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=224" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 224</bibl> Müll.; v. remulcum.</sense></entryFree>
promulgatio: <entryFree id="n38805" type="main" key="pro_mulga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmulgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>promulgo</etym>, <sense id="n38805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making publicly known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a proclaiming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promulgation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges nullā promulgatione latae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 10, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl>, a, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:19:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 19, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
promulgator: <entryFree id="n38806" type="hapax" key="pro_mulga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmulgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that publishes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proclaims</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">a promulgator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numa feriarum promulgator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Feriis Als. 3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Feriis Als. 3</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
promulgo: <entryFree id="n38807" type="main" key="pro_mulgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmulgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. unknown</etym>, in publicist's lang., <sense id="n38807.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to expose to public view</hi> (as a proposed new law, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promulgate</hi> (cf.: edico, pronuntio): promulgari leges dicuntur, cum primum in vulgus eduntur, quasi provulgari, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=224" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 224</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">leges cum quae latae sunt, tum quae promulgatae fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:25:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 25, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 10, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 42, 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 36, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 10, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 40, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res multos dies promulgata et cognita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 14, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies fastos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38807.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to teach</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">majores oculorum medicamentis aconitum misceri saluberrime promulgavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 3, 2, § 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
promulsidare: <entryFree id="n38808" type="main" key="pro_mulsi^da_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmulsĭdāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>promulsis</etym>, <sense id="n38808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tray on which the</hi> promulsis <hi rend="ital">was served</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in promulsidari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 31</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">promulsidaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:19:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 19, § 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
promulsis: <entryFree id="n38809" type="main" key="pro_mulsis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-mulsis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mulsum</etym>. <sense id="n38809.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a relish</hi> of eggs, salt fish, mead, etc., <hi rend="ital">served</hi> <cb n="PRON" /> <hi rend="ital">first at a Roman banquet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a whet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">antepast</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 20, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38809.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38809.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A foretaste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n38809.3" n="B" level="2"> For promulsidare, <hi rend="ital">the tray for the antepast</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
promulsus: <entryFree id="n38810" type="main" key="pro_mulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-mulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [mulceo], <sense id="n38810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stroked forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoothed down in front</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caproneae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1, p. 342, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
promunctorium: <entryFree id="n38811" type="gloss" key="promuncto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">promunctōrĭum</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">promukth/rion</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</entryFree>
promunturium: <entryFree id="n38812" type="main" key="pro_muntu^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmuntŭrĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prōmon-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pro-mineo</etym>. <sense id="n38812.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The highest part of a chain of mountains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mountain-ridge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 35, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38812.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A part of a mountain projecting into the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a headland</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promontory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:56:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 56, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 709</bibl> et saep.—As <hi rend="ital">nom. propr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38812.2" n="1" level="3"> Promunturium Apollinis, in Africa, near Utica, now <hi rend="ital">Zibib</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 24</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n38812.3" n="2" level="3"> Candidum, also in Africa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38812.4" n="3" level="3"> Pulchrum, east of Carthage, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38812.5" n="4" level="3"> Sacrum, in Portugal, now <hi rend="ital">Cabo de St. Vincente</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 108, 112, § 242</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38812.6" n="5" level="3"> Junonis, near Cadiz, now <hi rend="ital">C. Trafalgar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n38812.7" n="6" level="3"> Ampelusia, in Africa, now <hi rend="ital">Cabo Spartel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
promus: <entryFree id="n38813" type="main" key="pro_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>promo</etym>. <sense id="n38813.0" n="I" level="1"> In economic lang., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to giving out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distributing.</hi> cella, <hi rend="ital">a store-room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">larder</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38813.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-mum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a store-room</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Much more freq., </sense><sense id="n38813.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-mus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a giver out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distributor</hi> of provisions (opp. condus, the keeper of them); <cit><quote lang="la">and hence, in gen.,</quote> <trans><tr>a cellarer</tr>, <tr>steward</tr>, <tr>butler</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foris est promus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:16:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 22, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38813.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">librorum,</quote> <trans><tr>he who gives out books from a library</tr>, <tr>a librarian</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 308, 17</bibl></cit>: ego meo sum promus pectori, <hi rend="ital">I keep the key of my own breast</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I guard my heart against evil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
promuscis: <entryFree id="n38814" type="main" key="promuscis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">promuscis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis, a corrupt form for proboscis</itype>, <sense id="n38814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proboscis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephas, promuscis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 174</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
promutuor: <entryFree id="n38815" type="gloss" key="promu_tu^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pro-mūtŭor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n38815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be loaned beforehand</hi>: promutuor, <foreign lang="greek">prodanei/zomai</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
promutuus: <entryFree id="n38816" type="main" key="pro_mu_tu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-mūtŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n38816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">paid over beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advanced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loaned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicanis (imperabatur) insequentis anni vectigal promutuum,</quote> <trans><tr>was demanded in advance as a loan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (for which before: <cit><quote lang="la">insequentis anni mutua pecunia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 31, 2</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">vectura,</quote> <trans><tr>prepaid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 15</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38816.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmūtŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:40:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 7, 40, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pronaos: <entryFree id="n38817" type="main" key="pro^na_os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏnāos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. pronaus.</entryFree>
pronato: <entryFree id="n38818" type="main" key="pro_na^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-năto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swim forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swim along</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">delphines e toto mari pronatant ad Arionis cantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:17" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
pronatus: <entryFree id="n38819" type="main" key="pro_na_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from prono.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38820" type="hapax" key="pro_na_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-nātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n38820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sprung forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born</hi>, for prognatus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pronaus: <entryFree id="n38821" type="greek" key="pro^na_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏnāus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/naos</foreign>, <sense id="n38821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the porch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vestibule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portico of a temple</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7, 2</bibl>; 5, 1, 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">214</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prone: <entryFree id="n38822" type="main" key="pro_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pronus <sense id="n38822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pronecto: <entryFree id="n38823" type="main" key="pro_necto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-necto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to knit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spin out</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">seriem aevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:145" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 145</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pronepos: <entryFree id="n38824" type="main" key="pro^ne^pos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-nĕpos</orth> (scanned prōnĕpos, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great-grandson</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:14" default="NO">38, 10, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 606</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proneptis: <entryFree id="n38825" type="main" key="pro^neptis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-neptis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n38825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great-granddaughter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10" default="NO">10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:53" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pronis: <entryFree id="n38826" type="main" key="pro_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. pronus.</entryFree>
pronitas: <entryFree id="n38827" type="hapax" key="pro_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pronus</etym>, <sense id="n38827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inclination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propensity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proneness</hi>: naturae ad malum, Sen. Contr. praef., dub. (the phrase is wanting in several MSS.).</sense></entryFree>
prono: <entryFree id="n38828" type="main" key="pro_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bow</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi latrones ad pavimentum defuncti ora pronaverant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pronoea: <entryFree id="n38829" type="greek" key="pro^noea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏnoea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/noia</foreign>, <sense id="n38829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">providence</hi> (pure Lat. providentia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 160</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 22, 58</bibl>, written as Greek). <cb n="PRON" /></sense></entryFree>
pronomen: <entryFree id="n38830" type="main" key="pro_no_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-nōmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; <sense id="n38830.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in gram.,</quote> <trans><tr>a pronoun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 45</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:47" default="NO">1, 5, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:26" default="NO">26</bibl>; 11, 3, 87 et saep.</sense></entryFree>
pronominalis: <entryFree id="n38831" type="main" key="pro_no_mi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnōmĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pronomen</etym>, <sense id="n38831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a pronoun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pronominal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constructio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1069</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
pronominatio: <entryFree id="n38832" type="main" key="pro_no_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-nōmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n38832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a figure of speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by which another epithet is substituted for a proper name</hi> (e. g. Africani nepotes, for Gracchi), <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 31, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pronomino: <entryFree id="n38833" type="main" key="pro_no_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnōmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pronomen</etym>; <sense id="n38833.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in gram.,</quote> <trans><tr>to designate a person by a pronoun</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1064</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
pronubans: <entryFree id="n38834" type="hapax" key="pro_nu^bans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnŭbans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [pronuba], <sense id="n38834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">arranging a marriage</hi>: pronubante nobis maestitia, Hier. Vit. Malch. n. 6.</sense></entryFree>
pronubus: <entryFree id="n38835" type="main" key="pro_nu^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnŭbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pro-nubo</etym>, <sense id="n38835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to marriage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bridal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promoting marriage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <trans><tr>pimps</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulus,</quote> <trans><tr>wedding-ring</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <trans><tr>the bridal night</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Honor. 642</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <trans><tr>a bridal torch</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epigr. 2, 53</bibl></cit>.—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38835.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnŭbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">para/numfos</foreign>, auspex (2. b.), <hi rend="ital">the promoter of a marriage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a groomsman</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 6, 50, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accepit maritum suum de amicis ejus et pronubis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 14, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38835.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnŭ-ba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a woman who attended to the necessary arrangements of a wedding on the part of the bride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bridewoman</hi> (corresp. to the auspex on the part of the bridegroom), Varr ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=242" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 242</bibl> Müll., Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=244" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 244</bibl> ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Cast. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:11" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 11</bibl>.—Hence, Pronuba, <hi rend="ital">an epithet of Juno</hi>, the patron goddess of marriage, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 43</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">Bellona</hi>, as the presider over a marriage in which the bride is obtained by war, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 319</bibl>; also, of <hi rend="ital">one of the Furies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 207, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pronumero: <entryFree id="n38836" type="main" key="pro_nu^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-nŭmĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to count up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enumerate</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">versiculos pro morarum mercede,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pronuntiabilis: <entryFree id="n38837" type="hapax" key="pro_nunti^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnuntĭābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prōnunc-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pronuncio</etym>, <sense id="n38837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">declarative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enunciative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a complete sentence</tr>, <tr>a proposition</tr>, <tr>enunciation</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 29 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
pronuntiatio: <entryFree id="n38838" type="main" key="pro_nunti^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnuntĭātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prōnunc-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n38838.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A public declaration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclamation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā pronuntiatione factā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Of the <hi rend="ital">decision</hi> of a judge, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 20, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48</bibl>.— Of the <hi rend="ital">proclamation</hi> of a public crier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:8:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 8, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38838.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Expression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speech</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus opera Graeca pronuntiatione strategemata dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum est, quod ex ipsā pronuntiatione apparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:74" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38838.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38838.3" n="1" level="3"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">delivery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:7:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 11, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 15, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 1</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:10:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 14, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38838.4" n="2" level="3"> In logic, <hi rend="ital">a proposition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est, cur non omnis pronuntiatio aut vera aut falsa sit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 11, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38838.5" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a single articulate sound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elementa proprie dicuntur ipsae pronuntiationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 539</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
pronuntiative: <entryFree id="n38839" type="main" key="pro_nunti^a_ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnuntĭātīvē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prōnunc-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pronuntiativus <sense id="n38839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pronuntiativus: <entryFree id="n38840" type="main" key="pro_nunti^a_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnuntĭātīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prōnunc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pronuntio</etym>, <sense id="n38840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to declaration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declarative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enunciative;</hi> in gram.: <cit><quote lang="la">pronuntiativus modus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the indicative mood</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 329</bibl></cit> P.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnuntĭātīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">declaratively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affirmatively</hi>, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pronuntiator: <entryFree id="n38841" type="main" key="pro_nunti^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnuntĭātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prōnunc-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n38841.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who delivers any thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a reciter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meae orationi M. Caesar actor contigit et pronuntiator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 6</bibl></cit> Mai.—</sense><sense id="n38841.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a relater</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thucydides rerum gestarum pronuntiator sincerus et grandis etiam fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:287" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 287</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pronuntiatum: <entryFree id="n38842" type="main" key="pro_nunti^a_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnuntĭātum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prōnunc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. pronuntio <sense id="n38842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pronuntiatus: <entryFree id="n38843" type="main" key="pro_nunti^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnuntĭātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prōnunc-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype> (only in <sense id="n38843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pronuntio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">pronunciation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ratio in pronuntiatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:17:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 17, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:3:1" default="NO">15, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pronuntio: <entryFree id="n38844" type="main" key="pro_nunti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-nuntĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prōnunc-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n38844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make publicly known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">announce</hi> (cf.: edico, promulgo). </sense><sense id="n38844.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38844.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: palam <pb n="1467" /> <cb n="PRON" /> de sellā ac tribunali pronuntiat, sese ejus nomen recepturum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:38:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 38, § 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum consules amplius de consilii sententiā pronuntiavissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 22, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to deliver the verdict</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:12:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex ita pronuntiavit,</quote> <trans><tr>pronounced the decision</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 16, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">re auditā, pronuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:15" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium in posterum diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:8:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:1" default="NO">7, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem in venundando,</quote> <trans><tr>to notify at the time of sale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 16, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jusserunt pronuntiare, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 33, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pronuntiare jusserunt, ne quis ab loco discederet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum omnium maximus judex, cujus est non argumentari sed pronuntiare verum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—Of a public crier: <cit><quote lang="la">pronuntiare victorum nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38844.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38844.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To nominate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appoint</hi> as public officer: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem praetorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38844.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To sentence</hi> (post-class.); with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">protectores pronuntiati vertere solum in exilio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad bestias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:1:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 1, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38844.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To promise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offer</hi> as a reward: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia militi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:45" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:29:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 29, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunis vocatis nummos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 118:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 118, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militibus donativum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe Darius mille talenta interfectori Alexandri daturum pronuntiari jusserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronuntiasse (sc. nummos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 18, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38844.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38844.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To speak</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">in public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to recite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rehearse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pronounce</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">versus multos uno spiritu pronuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 261</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 19, 88</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 56, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:12 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 12 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 12</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n38844.9" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to act</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi> on the stage: <cit><quote lang="la">intente instanterque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 19, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actores pronuntiare dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=58" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 58</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucceia mima centum annis in scenā pronuntiavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 158</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38844.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To tell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">announce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">report</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eam rem scisset et non pronuntiasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 16, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercatores quibus ex regionibus veniant, pronuntiare cogunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae gesta sunt pronuntiare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid sincere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius jam capta castra pronuntiat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38844.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To utter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pronounce</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">appello, dico): neque tamen ad particula accentu acuto pronuntiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl></cit> (7), 8, 8, § <cit><quote lang="la">2: Castorem mediă syllabă productă,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:34" default="NO">9, 4, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba corrupte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:30:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 30, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnuntĭātum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prōnunc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> In logic, <hi rend="ital">a proposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">axiom;</hi> a translation of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)ci/wma</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:7:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 7, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pronuper: <entryFree id="n38845" type="spur" key="pro_nu_per"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-nūper</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, in a supposititious verse, ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 26</bibl>; v. parerga, I. p. 528 Ritschl sq.</entryFree>
pronurus: <entryFree id="n38846" type="main" key="pro_nu^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-nŭrus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n38846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grandson's wife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 4</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=224" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 224</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">pronurus et magni Laomedontis ero,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the wife of Paris</tr>, <tr>who was grandson of Laomedon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 206</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pronus: <entryFree id="n38847" type="main" key="pro_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (archaic form of <sense id="n38847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> pronis, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 494 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> [like Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pra=nh/s</foreign> = <foreign lang="greek">prhnh/s</foreign>, from root pra-, <foreign lang="greek">pro/</foreign>; cf. prae). </sense><sense id="n38847.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">turned forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inclined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leaning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hanging forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stooping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bending down</hi> (class.; opp. supinus; cf. cernuus). </sense><sense id="n38847.2" n="1" level="3"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum imponere equo pronum in ventrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronus pendens in verbera,</quote> <trans><tr>leaning forward to strike</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 586</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum Pronum sterne solo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 485</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronus magister Volvitur in caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecora, quae natura prona finxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 379</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of those running swiftly, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:652" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 652</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leporem pronum catulo sectare sagaci,</quote> <trans><tr>flying swiftly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 201</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38847.3" n="2" level="3"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">bending forward</hi> or <hi rend="ital">downward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">going</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inclined downward</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilex paulum modo prona, dein flexa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 93:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 93, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prona ac fastigiata tigna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronae atque vergentes ampullae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 30, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demissus inde pronusque pulvinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(urbs) prona in paludes,</quote> <trans><tr>sinking down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crateres,</quote> <trans><tr>overturned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:255" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:53:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 53, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 14, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prona via,</quote> <trans><tr>steep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 424</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PROP" /> —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil habent proni et supera semper petunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per pronum ire,</quote> <trans><tr>downwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 123, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per prona voluti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:235" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 235</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38847.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38847.5" n="1" level="3"> Of the heavenly bodies, of time, etc., <hi rend="ital">setting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declining</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pronus Orion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Titan,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:41" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">menses (=celeriter praetereuntes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38847.6" n="2" level="3"> Of localities, <hi rend="ital">turned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">looking</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lying towards</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n38847.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca Aquiloni prona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificii solum pronius orienti,</quote> <trans><tr>situated more to the east</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38847.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campo patente et ad solem prono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38847.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">inclined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prone</hi> to any thing (class.); usu. constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">dat.;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38847.10" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n38847.11" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae genus inclinatum et quasi pronum ad perniciosissimum statum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:26:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 26, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anxitudo prona ad luctum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 41, 68</bibl></cit> (from <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 72, 31</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">boves ad domandum proni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronus ad omne nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronus ad cujusque necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad poëticam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad simultates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:84" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 84</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: ad indulgentias pronissimus, Capit. Anton. 10, 8.—</sense><sense id="n38847.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in obsequium plus aequo pronus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeculum in omnia mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">prona est timori semper in pejus fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 316" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 316</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38847.13" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronus deterioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 41</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures offensioni proniores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n38847.14" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ruendi In ferrum mens prona viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 461</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus audendi pronior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Ruf. 2, 400</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38847.15" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38847.16" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Inclined to favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi> to any thing (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n38847.17" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si modo prona bonis invicti Caesaris assint Numina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:8:61" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 8, 61</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors Cn. Dolabellae pronior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38847.18" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prona in eum aula Neronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quis misericordiā in Germanicum pronior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in verum nepotem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cat. 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38847.19" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">prona sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:340" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronis auribus accipere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 501</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos pronior fortuna comitatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:69:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 69, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38847.20" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Easy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without difficulty</hi> (mostly post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia virtuti suae prona esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 114:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 114, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia prona victoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronum ad honores iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via ad regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: pronum est, <hi rend="ital">it is easy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere memoratu digna pronum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitos praebere deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile et pronum est agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:43" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 43</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id pronius ad fidem est,</quote> <trans><tr>is easier to believe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 28</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōnē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">downwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pronely</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n38847.21" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Petr.</author> Vit. S. Mart. 4, 546</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38847.22" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">readily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">willingly; comp.</hi> pronius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 8, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prooeconomia: <entryFree id="n38848" type="greek" key="pro^oeco^no^mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏoecŏnŏmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prooikonomi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n38848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a previous arrangement</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 5, 858</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 468</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prooemior: <entryFree id="n38849" type="main" key="pro^oemi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏoemĭor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>prooemium</etym>, <sense id="n38849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make an introduction</hi> or <hi rend="ital">preface</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">prooemiatur apte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prooemium: <entryFree id="n38850" type="greek" key="pro^oemi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏoemĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prooi/mion</foreign>. <sense id="n38850.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An introduction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preface</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proem</hi> (class.; syn.: exordium, principium): quod principium Latine vel exordium dicitur, majore quădam ratione Graeci videntur <foreign lang="greek">prooi/mion</foreign> nominasse: <cit><quote lang="la">quia a nostris initium modo significatur, illi satis clare partem hanc esse ante ingressum rei, de quă dicendum sit, ostendunt ..certe prooemium est, quod apud judicem, priusquam causam cognoverit, prosit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:1" default="NO">2, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:1" default="NO">3, 9, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 11, 28 et saep.: citharoedi prooemium,</quote> <trans><tr>prelude</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longo et alte petito prooemio respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:21:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 21, 58</bibl></cit>' volumen prooemiorum . .prooemio abuti prooemium exarare, desecare, agglutinare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legis prooemium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38850.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a beginning</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): rixae, Juv 3, 288.</sense></entryFree>
propagatio: <entryFree id="n38851" type="main" key="pro_^pa_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō^pāgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. propago</etym>, <sense id="n38851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a propagating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propagation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38851.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">propagatio vitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propagationum genera tria sunt in usu maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propagationes facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38851.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: quae propagatio et soboles origo est rerum publicarum, Cic. <cb n="PROP" /> Off. 1, 17, 54.—</sense><sense id="n38851.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38851.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An extending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolonging; an extension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlargement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolongation</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">finium imperii nostri propagatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserrimi temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam, triumphum, propagationem imperii portandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 30, 9</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38851.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An establishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honoring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:14:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 14, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propagator: <entryFree id="n38852" type="main" key="pro_^pa_ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō^pāgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. propago</etym>, <sense id="n38852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a propagator;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">an enlarger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extender</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">provinciae propagator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 3</bibl></cit> (al. prorogator).—<hi rend="ital">An epithet of Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as the enlarger of boundaries</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 75, 10: <cit><quote lang="la">ORBIS AC REI PUBLICAE ROMANAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 271, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propages: <entryFree id="n38853" type="main" key="pro_^pa_ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō^pāges</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> <sense id="n38853.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">layer;</hi> for the usual propago: propages progenies a propagando: ut faciunt rustici, eum vitem vetulam supprimunt, ut ex eā unā plures faciant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=227" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 227</bibl> Müll.— </sense><sense id="n38853.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">offspring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progeny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">posterity</hi> (ante- and post-class.): mea propages sanguinis, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 64, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Col. Carm. 5, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propaginatio: <entryFree id="n38854" type="main" key="pro_pa_gi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpāgĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>propagino</etym>, <sense id="n38854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">propagation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 17, 5, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propagino: <entryFree id="n38855" type="main" key="pro_^pa_gi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō^pāgĭno</orth>, no <sense id="n38855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. propago</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to propagate</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">populi propaginati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
propagmen: <entryFree id="n38856" type="main" key="propagmen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">propagmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">propagation;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">prolongation</hi>: vitae, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 64, 32</bibl> (Ann. v. 458 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
propago: <entryFree id="n38857" type="main" key="pro_^pa_go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō^pāgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pro and root pag- of pango, <foreign lang="greek">ph/gnumi</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n38857.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38857.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fasten down;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to set slips</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propagate by slips</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 52, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castanea melius ex vicino pertica declinata propagatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem, ficum, oleam, Punicam, malorum genera omnia, laurum, prunos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 13, 21, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abrotonum cacumine suo se propagat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 10, 34, § 60</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n38857.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to propagate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue by procreation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipse sui generis initium ac nominis ab se gigni et propagari vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:70:section=180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 70, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prolem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:996" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 996</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38857.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38857.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:12:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finis imperii propagavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo bello terminos populi Romani propagari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terminos Urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augere et propagare imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propagatae civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus cenarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notitiam Britanniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 16, 30, § 102</bibl></cit>: fidem Christianam propagare, Greg. M. in Job, 27, 37.—</sense><sense id="n38857.5" n="B" level="2"> In time, <hi rend="ital">to prolong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">prorogo, produco): victu fero vitam propagare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec posteritati propagantur,</quote> <trans><tr>are transferred to posterity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:48:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 48, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus consulatus multa saecula propagarit rei publicae,</quote> <trans><tr>has preserved the State for many centuries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam aucupio,</quote> <trans><tr>to prolong</tr>, <tr>preserve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam aeternam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 49</bibl></cit>: imperium consuli in annum, <hi rend="ital">to prolong</hi>, = prorogare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 25, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditarium bellum, sic facta hominis vita est temporaria, sed longa, quae in mille annos propagaretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 12, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38857.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To add as an appendix</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extension</hi>, in writing: <cit><quote lang="la">Carum cum liberis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the life of</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> 24, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38858" type="main" key="pro_^pa_go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō^pāgo</orth> (prŏ-, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:870" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 870</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 38</bibl>: <sense id="n38858.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">prō-,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 26</bibl></cit>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, Fab. Pict. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 13</bibl>) [1. propago]. </sense><sense id="n38858.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38858.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">layer</hi> of a plant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 7:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores aut semine proveniunt, aut plantis radicis, aut propagine, aut avulsione, aut surculo, aut insito et consecto arboris trunco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 9, § 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38858.3" n="2" level="3"> Of any <hi rend="ital">slip</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shoot</hi> that may be used for propagating: propagines e vitibus altius praetentos non succidet, Fab. Pict. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:9" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 40, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38858.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of men and beasts, <hi rend="ital">offspring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">child; children</hi>, <hi rend="ital">race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progeny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">posterity</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1027" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1027</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Memmi clara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alipedis de stirpe dei versuta propago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:871" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 871</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">blanda catulorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:997" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 997</bibl></cit>.—In prose: <cit><quote lang="la">aliorum ejus liberorum propago Liciniani sunt cognominati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 14, 12, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarorum virorum propagines,</quote> <trans><tr>descendants</tr>, <tr>posterity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 18, 2</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1468" /> <cb n="PROP" /></sense></entryFree>
