propalam: <entryFree id="n38859" type="main" key="pro_pa^lam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-pălam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n38859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">openly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publicly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notoriously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifestly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">minus jam furtificus sum: rapio propalam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: signis propalam collocatis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obviam ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii propalam, alii per occultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propalam aspici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timeo, ne hoc propalam fiat,</quote> <trans><tr>may become manifest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 38</bibl></cit>: propalam est, <hi rend="ital">it is clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2435" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2435</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
propalo: <entryFree id="n38860" type="main" key="pro_pa^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpălo</orth>, no <sense id="n38860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>propalam</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make public</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to divulge</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propalata et publica veritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinitus propalatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 137" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum propalatam esse sanctorum viam,</quote> <trans><tr>thrown open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 9, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propansus: <entryFree id="n38861" type="main" key="pro_pansus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-pansus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-passus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n38861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Partt.</hi> [pando], <hi rend="ital">spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extended</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">propansis pinnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 179, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propassis pennis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. p. 365, 35</bibl></cit> (or de Deo Socr. p. 109 Hild.).</sense></entryFree>
propatior: <entryFree id="n38862" type="main" key="pro_pa^ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-pătĭor</orth>, <itype>ti</itype>, <sense id="n38862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to endure before</hi> (post-class.), Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propator: <entryFree id="n38863" type="greek" key="pro^pa^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpător</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">propa/twr</foreign>, <sense id="n38863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forefather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ancestor</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praes. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propatruus: <entryFree id="n38864" type="main" key="pro_patru^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-patrŭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great-grandfather's brother</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10" default="NO">10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propatulus: <entryFree id="n38865" type="main" key="pro_pa^tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-pătŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n38865.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Open in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not covered up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncovered</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in aperto ac propatulo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 110</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n38865.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpătŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an open</hi> or <hi rend="ital">uncovered place.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38865.2" n="A" level="2"> In phrase in propatulo (class.): in propatulo ac silvestribus locis, <hi rend="ital">in the open air</hi> (opp.: domi sub tecto), Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 1</bibl>: in propatulo aedium, <hi rend="ital">in the open court</hi>, Liv 24, 16, 17.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: in propatulo, <hi rend="ital">publicly</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">pudicitiam in propatulo habere,</quote> <trans><tr>offer it publicly</tr>, <tr>expose it to sale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in propatulo esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 10, 8</bibl></cit> (with in promptu); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:14:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 284, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas in propatulo abicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 9, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38865.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi>: propatulo, <hi rend="ital">in the open air</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Mossyni propatulo vescuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prope: <entryFree id="n38866" type="main" key="pro^pe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpe</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>pro and demonstr suff. -pe (cf.: nempe, quippe), = Sanscr. -pa</etym>. <sense id="n38866.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> propius, and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> proxime, v. under propior), <hi rend="ital">near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nigh</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38866.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in space: <cit><quote lang="la">quaenam vox mihi prope hic sonat? Quis hic loquitur prope?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope ad aliquem adire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes accedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope alicubi esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intueri aliquid (opp. procul),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 14, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38866.2" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum tam prope a Siciliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope a meis aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope ab domo detineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>.—So, <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae, aliae propius a terris, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius visere mala reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38866.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38866.4" n="1" level="3"> In time, <hi rend="ital">near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not far off</hi>: partus instabat prope, <hi rend="ital">was near at hand</hi>, Ter Ad. 3, 2, 9.—Esp. with <hi rend="ital">quando</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the time is near</hi> or <hi rend="ital">not far off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">prope est, quando herus pretium exsolvet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope adest, quom alieno more vivendum est mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partitudo prope adest, ut fiat palam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:17:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 17, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox prope diremit colloquium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the approach of night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 33, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 28, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 16, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38866.5" n="2" level="3"> In degree, <hi rend="ital">nearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">almost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pene, ferme, fere): ejus filiam ille amare coepit perdite, Prope jam ut pro uxore haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:4:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 4, § 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope funeratus Arboris ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope firmissima earum regionum civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos prope nonaginta natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope desperatis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic prope oneratum est sinistrum cornu, ni, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:65:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 65, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope est factum ut exirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope est ut aliquid fiat,</quote> <trans><tr>something must be done</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:67" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope perditae res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 46, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fidenae prope saepius captae, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope desertum oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:51:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 51, 8</bibl></cit>.—After the word it qualifies: <cit><quote lang="la">biennium prope,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 25, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps prope Stoicorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eisdem prope verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:25:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 25, 64</bibl></cit>: his prope verbis <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 6, 15</bibl>: cursu <cb n="PROP" /> prope Chalcidem contendit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 24, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">admirabilior prope,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes prope,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:49:14" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 49, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 30, 8</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius nihil est factum, quam ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quidquam propius est factum, quam ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 21, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38866.6" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> propius, with inspicio, considero, nosco, etc., <hi rend="ital">more closely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">better</hi> (post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">qualis esset ejus (mortis) velut propius inspectae natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 30:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 30, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius inspicere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 5:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit futurum ut diviti displiceret propius inspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:9:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Contr. 2, 9, 21</bibl></cit>, B.; 4, 15, 3; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 95, 1: quam (lancem) cum Agamemnon propius consideraret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius noscendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. penitus.—</sense><sense id="n38866.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n38866.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in space, <hi rend="ital">near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope hostium castra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo prope me, sed plane mecum habitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedens prope limina tecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:137" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 137</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38866.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38866.10" n="1" level="3"> In time, <hi rend="ital">nigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope lucem,</quote> <trans><tr>towards daybreak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 44</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38866.11" n="2" level="3"> Of abstract proximity, <hi rend="ital">near to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">almost to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not far from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope metum res fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope seditionem ventum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propediem: <entryFree id="n38867" type="main" key="pro^pe^di^em"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕdĭem</orth> (also separate, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prope diem</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>prope-dies</etym>, <sense id="n38867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at an early day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very soon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shortly</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prognostica mea propediem exspecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propediem te videbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 23, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 56:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 56, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propediem,</quote> <trans><tr>prematurely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propello: <entryFree id="n38868" type="main" key="pro_pello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-pello</orth> (prŏpellat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1026" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1026</bibl>), <itype>pŭli, pulsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n38868.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to drive before one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">push</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">urge forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drive forth; to hurl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurl</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overthrow</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: proturbo, protrudo): sacerdotem anum praecipem propulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves potum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra prae se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propellere ac submovere hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem a castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in profundum e scopulo corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 593</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:571" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <trans><tr>to overthrow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:383" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muros Oechaliae,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 162" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 162</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem propellere dialecticorum remis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:5:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si paulo largius L. Caecilium pietas et fraternus amor propulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 23, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38868.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38868.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To push</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thrust forward</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cruda studia in forum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38868.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To drive on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrore carceris ad voluntariam mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:530" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 530</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38868.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To drive away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ward off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum vitae ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias hominum ac ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propemodo: <entryFree id="n38869" type="main" key="pro^pe^mo^do^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕ-mŏdŏ</orth> <etym>weakened from propemodum; cf. postmodo</etym>, <sense id="n38869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">almost</hi>: tenes jam? <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> propemodo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 50</bibl> (cf. Ritschl ad loc.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 42</bibl> (Ritschl and Fleck. propemodum.)</sense></entryFree>
propemodum: <entryFree id="n38870" type="main" key="pro^pe^mo^dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕmŏdum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>prope-modus</etym>. <sense id="n38870.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Nearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">almost</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">propemodum jam scio, quid siet rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 42</bibl> Ritschl: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim sors est! idem propemodum, quod micare, quod talos jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabas propemodum dinumerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:43:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 43, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propemodum assentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:39:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 39, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38870.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In like manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec una res aeque utrisque est propemodum conparanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 8, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propempticon: <entryFree id="n38871" type="greek" key="pro^pempti^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpemptĭcon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">propemptiko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n38871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a farewell poem</hi>, in which a prosperous journey is wished: <cit><quote lang="la">propempticon Metio Celeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 24</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
propendeo: <entryFree id="n38872" type="main" key="pro_pendeo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-pendeo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, 2</itype> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 39</bibl>, the correct reading is propendes), <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hang forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hang down.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38872.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex ramis propendens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 20, § 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanx propendet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:17:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 17, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38872.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38872.3" n="A" level="2"> (The figure borrowed from the descending scale of a balance.) <hi rend="ital">To weigh more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haec the preponderance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dependes nec propendes,</quote> <trans><tr>weighest neither less nor more</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bona propendent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tuse. 5, 31, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38872.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be inclined</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disposed</hi> to any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">si suā sponte quo impellimus, inclinant atque propendent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2</bibl></cit>, <cb n="PROP" /> 44, 18.—</sense><sense id="n38872.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be well disposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinatione voluntatis propendere in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:29:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 29, 129</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-pensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n38872.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hanging down</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">propensum labrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propenso sesquipede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:57" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit> dub. —</sense><sense id="n38872.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = magno pene praeditus (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38872.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38872.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Inclining towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coming near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approaching</hi> (class.); with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputatio ad veritatis similitudinem propensior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:40:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 40, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad veritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38872.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Heavy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weighty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">important</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">illa de meā pecuniā ramenta fiat plumea propensior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id fit propensius,</quote> <trans><tr>more weighty</tr>, <tr>important</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:2:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38872.11" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Inclined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prone</hi> to any thing (syn. proclivis); usually constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> rarely with <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n38872.12" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam propensus ad misericordiam, quam inclinatus ad severitatem videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus propensus ad salutem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad liberalitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 31</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo ad voluptates propensior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad lenitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 31, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus alius ad alia vitia propensior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt propensiores ad bene merendum quam ad reposcendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38872.13" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propensus in alteram partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propensior benignitas esse debebit in calamitosos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in neutram partem propensiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38872.14" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in divisione regni propensior fuisse Alexandro videbatur,</quote> <trans><tr>more disposed to favor Alexander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 1, 2</bibl></cit> (al. pro Alexandro).— </sense><sense id="n38872.15" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">well-disposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">willing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">propenso animo aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propensum favorem petiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 706</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: propensissimā civitatum voluntate, Auct. B. Alex. 26.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpensē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">willingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">readily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with inclination</hi> (class.): conspiratio propense facta, Lentulus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 15, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propensius senatum facturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eoque propensius laudandus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 98</bibl></cit> Oud.</sense></entryFree>
propendo: <entryFree id="n38873" type="main" key="pro_pendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. propendeo <sense id="n38873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
propendulus: <entryFree id="n38874" type="main" key="pro_pendu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-pendŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>propendeo</etym>, <sense id="n38874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hanging forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hanging down</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">propenduli crines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1, p. 342, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propense: <entryFree id="n38875" type="main" key="pro_pense_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpensē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. propendeo, <sense id="n38875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
propensio: <entryFree id="n38876" type="hapax" key="pro_pensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>propendeo</etym>, <sense id="n38876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inclination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propensity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propensio ad summum bonum adipiscendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:17:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 17, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propensus: <entryFree id="n38877" type="main" key="pro_pensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from propendeo.</entryFree>
properabilis: <entryFree id="n38878" type="main" key="pro^pe^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>propero</etym>, <sense id="n38878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hasty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">calor (opp. rigor tardabilis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
properans: <entryFree id="n38879" type="main" key="pro^pe^rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from propero.</entryFree>
properanter: <entryFree id="n38880" type="main" key="pro^pe^ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>propero</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, A. <sense id="n38880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
properantia: <entryFree id="n38881" type="main" key="pro^pe^ranti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕrantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>propero</etym>, <sense id="n38881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hastening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haste</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): ex tantā properantiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum ex properantiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
properatim: <entryFree id="n38882" type="main" key="pro^pe^ra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕrātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>properatus</etym>, <sense id="n38882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hastily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedily</hi> (ante-class.): properatim conficere opus, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 153, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergis properatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:ib. 155:3" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> ib. 155, 3</bibl></cit>; also Sisenn. acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 15, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
properatio: <entryFree id="n38883" type="main" key="pro^pe^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>propero</etym>, <sense id="n38883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hastening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speediness</hi> (rare but class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 2</bibl>; Q. Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 27, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">properationem explorare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 50</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 5, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
properato: <entryFree id="n38884" type="main" key="pro^pe^ra_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕrātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>propero</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, B. <sense id="n38884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
properatus: <entryFree id="n38885" type="main" key="pro^pe^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from propero.</entryFree>
propere: <entryFree id="n38886" type="main" key="pro^pe^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕrē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕrĭter</orth>, <sense id="n38886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. properus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, A. and B.</sense></entryFree>
properipes: <entryFree id="n38887" type="main" key="pro^pe^ri^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕrĭpēs</orth>, <itype>ĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>properus pes</etym>, <sense id="n38887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swift of foot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducem sequuntur Gallae properipedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propero: <entryFree id="n38888" type="main" key="pro^pe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>properus</etym>. <sense id="n38888.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quicken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accelerate; to prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">do with haste</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">alia quae incepto usui forent properare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itineris properandi causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> <pb n="1469" /> <cb n="PROP" /> 105, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">properato itinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 112:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 112, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vascula intus pure propera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam heredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:205" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 205</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 401</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coeptum iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc studium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera properabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:21" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 21</bibl></cit>: teneri properentur amores, Dum vacat, <hi rend="ital">let them be sung hastily</hi> or <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">properatur amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc porticus, inde delubra properantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:51:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 51, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38888.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make haste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be quick</hi> (class.): aliud est properare, aliud festinare. Qui unum quid mature transigit, is properat: qui multa simul incipit neque perficit, is festinat, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:14:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 14, 2</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=234" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 234</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 441, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propera, fer pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">properatin' ocius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulabat sese negotii causā properare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 76:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 76, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:58:6" default="NO" valid="yes">58, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad praedam, ad gloriam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:19:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 658</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacris, for a sacris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 201</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 58</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but sometimes with collat. notion of excessive haste: properantibus Blaesus advenit, increpabatque, etc. (cf. the context),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 17</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: ultro licentiam in vos auctum, atque adjutum properatis, Sall. Or. Licin. ad Pleb. (H. 3, 61, 16 Dietsch).—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum propere propera vomere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redire in patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin huc ad vos venire propero?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa inferre, atque evadere oppido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 56, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem amando Perdere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se quisque hostem ferire properabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">properatum vehementer, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 19, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 416</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate subjects, with <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala decerpi properantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 52</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n38888.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">hastening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedy</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ille properans, festinans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec properantes scripsimus,</quote> <trans><tr>in haste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 4</bibl></cit>, a.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotam solito properantior urget,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 2, 337</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕran-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">hastily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">propere, cito, festinanter, celeriter, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">properanter accepit codicillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia properantius, quam aes mutuum, reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 96:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 96, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:673" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 673</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: properantissime aliquid afferre, Cod. Th. 11, 30, 8.—</sense><sense id="n38888.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">hurried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accelerated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedy</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tabellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 586</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 748</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meta curribus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rapidly approached</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:50:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 50, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 80</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">properatius tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 26</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: properato opus est, <hi rend="ital">there is need of haste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accurato et properato opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat nihil, cur properato opus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:19:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 19, 49</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕrā-tō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedily</hi> (Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">properato ad mortem agitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propertius: <entryFree id="n38889" type="main" key="Pro^perti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏpertĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> So, Sex. Aurelius Propertius, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated elegiac poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an older contemporary of Ovid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:93" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 93</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> Properti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:465 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 465 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
properus: <entryFree id="n38890" type="main" key="pro^pe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root par-, to make; whence parare, parĕre</etym>, <sense id="n38890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hastening</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): properam pro celeri ac strenuā dixisse antiquos, testimonio est <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Fest. p. 253</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">properi aurigae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Telamon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:176" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe ac juventā properus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi quisque properus,</quote> <trans><tr>each one hastening for himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (Tacitean): <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippina oblatae occasionis propera,</quote> <trans><tr>quickly seizing the proffered occasion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindictae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (Tacitean): <cit><quote lang="la">quoquo facinore properus clarescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 52</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms. </sense><sense id="n38890.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">hastily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in haste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedily</hi>:<cb n="PROP" />  ut propere tonuit! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propere sequere me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 91:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 91, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">egredere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propere Cumas se recepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves onerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 86:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 86, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propere propero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propere, cito introite, et cito deproperate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propere, celeriter eloquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum propere propera vomere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac te propere celerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38890.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĕrĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">hastily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi> (ante- and post-class.): classem in altum properiter deducere, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 155, 6</bibl>: navem in fugam tradunt, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 155</bibl>. 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 184, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>, p. 198, 33; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propes: <entryFree id="n38891" type="main" key="pro^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-pēs</orth>, <itype>ĕdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the loose part of the sheet with which a sail is trimmed to the wind</hi> (ante-class.), Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propetrare: <entryFree id="n38892" type="gloss" key="pro_petra_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpetrāre</orth>, mandare quod perficiatur; nam impetrare est exorare, et perpetrare perficere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=227" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 227</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
propexus: <entryFree id="n38893" type="main" key="pro_pexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-pexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [pecto], <sense id="n38893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">combed forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combed down in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hanging down</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): crines, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 605</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propexam in pectore barbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:838" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 838</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propexam ad pectora barbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:259" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propexa mento Canities,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:97" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propexis in pectora barbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:310" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 310</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propheta: <entryFree id="n38894" type="greek" key="pro^phe_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏphēta</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏphētes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">profh/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n38894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foreteller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothsayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophet</hi> (post-class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vates): prophetas in Adrasto Julius nominat antistites fanorum oraculorumque interpretes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=229" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 229</bibl></cit> Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 194 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">prophetae quidam, deorum majestate completi, effantur ceteris, quae divino beneficio soli vident, App. de Mundo, p. 56, 29: sacerdotes Aegyptiorum, quos prophetas vocant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptius, propheta primarius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 127, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of the Jewish prophets, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 24, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 1, 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prophetalis: <entryFree id="n38895" type="main" key="pro^phe_ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏphētālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>propheta</etym>, <sense id="n38895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prophetic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetical</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 54</bibl></cit>, n. 17: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus, Hilar. in Matt. 2, 2: scriptura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prophetatio: <entryFree id="n38896" type="main" key="pro^phe_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏphētātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>propheto</etym>, <sense id="n38896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soothsaying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesying</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 10, 32; 18, 14.</sense></entryFree>
prophetia: <entryFree id="n38897" type="greek" key="pro^phe_ti_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏphētīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">profhtei/a</foreign>, <sense id="n38897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prediction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophecy</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 1, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38897.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A body of prophets</hi> or <hi rend="ital">singers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:15:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 15, 27</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
prophetialis: <entryFree id="n38898" type="main" key="pro^phe_ti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏphētĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prophetia</etym>, <sense id="n38898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to prophecy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetic</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">patrocinium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prophetice: <entryFree id="n38899" type="main" key="pro^phe_ti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏphētĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. propheticus <sense id="n38899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
propheticus: <entryFree id="n38900" type="greek" key="pro^phe_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏphētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">profhtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n38900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">predicting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetical</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Moyses propheticus, non poëticus pastor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Pet. 1, 19.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏphētĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">prophetically</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">prophetice dictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Mon. 4</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 44.</sense></entryFree>
prophetis: <entryFree id="n38901" type="greek" key="pro^phe_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏphētis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">profh=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n38901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prophetess</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 4, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prophetissa: <entryFree id="n38902" type="main" key="pro^phe_tissa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏphētissa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>propheta</etym>, <sense id="n38902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prophetess</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 2, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prophetizo: <entryFree id="n38903" type="main" key="pro^phe_ti_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏphētīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prophesy</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:26:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 26, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:22:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 22, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propheto: <entryFree id="n38904" type="main" key="pro^phe_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏphēto</orth>, no <sense id="n38904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>1, ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesy</hi> (eccl. Lat.; cf.: praedico, vaticinor): docet, instruit, prophetat, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 13, 101: <cit><quote lang="la">servi prophetaturi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors Christi prophetata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res. Carn. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 15, 7</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">PROPHETAVIT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4872</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propina: <entryFree id="n38905" type="main" key="pro^pi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, for popina, <sense id="n38905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cook-shop</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
propinatio: <entryFree id="n38906" type="main" key="pro^pi_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpīnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>propino</etym>. <sense id="n38906.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A drinking to one's health</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pledging</hi> in something (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tralaticiā propinatione dignus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propinationem ab aliquo accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:21:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 21, 5</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">propinationibus crebris aliquem lacessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:33:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 33, 6</bibl></cit>: propinationes tuas recusant, <hi rend="ital">decline your invitations to drink a</hi> <cb n="PROP" /> <hi rend="ital">health</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 83, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38906.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a funeral banquet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 753, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propino: <entryFree id="n38907" type="greek" key="pro^pi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpīno</orth> (the first o scanned long, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:69:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 69, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82" default="NO">3, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:6" default="NO">8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 15</bibl>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">propi/nw</foreign>. <sense id="n38907.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To drink to one's health</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pledge</hi> one in something (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">propino poculum magnum: ille ebibit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem,</quote> <trans><tr>to drink a health</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propino hoc pulchro Critiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum calicem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:15:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38907.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38907.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To give one to drink</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">propinas modo conditum Sabinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:49:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 49, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:25" default="NO">3, 82, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:25:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 25, 15</bibl>.—Of medicines, <hi rend="ital">to give to drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">administer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam comitialibus morbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38907.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To give to eat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set before</hi> one (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">venenatam partem fratri edendam propinans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aurel. 15</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38907.4" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi> to one (ante- and post-class.): mortalibus Versus flammeos, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 33, 8</bibl> (Sat. v. 7 Vahl.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 54, 3</bibl>: hunc comedendum et deridendum vobis propino, <hi rend="ital">pass him on to you</hi> (as a cup was passed), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellas alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to furnish</tr>, <tr>procure</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 172, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38907.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to water</hi> plants, <hi rend="ital">supply with water;</hi> with <case>dat.</case> vineae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 27, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propinque: <entryFree id="n38908" type="main" key="pro^pinque_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpinquē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. propinquus <sense id="n38908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
propinquitas: <entryFree id="n38909" type="main" key="pro^pinqui^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpinquĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>propinquus</etym>, <sense id="n38909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nearness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicinity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proximity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propinquity</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38909.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place: <cit><quote lang="la">ex longinquitate, propinquitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex propinquitate pugnare,</quote> <trans><tr>from a short distance</tr>, <tr>close at hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis imminebat propter propinquitatem Aegina Piraeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 11, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 15</bibl>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvarum ac fluminum petunt propinquitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38909.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38909.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Relationship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affinity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propinquity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si pietate propinquitas colitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinculis propinquitatis conjunctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilis propinquitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcta,</quote> <trans><tr>near relationship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus propinquitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ruth, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si propinquitates summo bono non contineantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38909.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Intimacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendship</hi> (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad probos propinquitate se adjungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38909.5" n="C" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a kinsman</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in propinquitatis perniciem inclinatior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 7 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
propinquo: <entryFree id="n38910" type="main" key="pro^pinquo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpinquo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>propinquus</etym>. <sense id="n38910.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accelerate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tu rite propinques Augurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:281" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 281</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38910.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to draw near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come nigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approach</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose for appropinquo); with <case>dat.</case> or <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n38910.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n38910.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulo propinquat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 410</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38910.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnem, Sall. Fragm. ap. Arus. Mess. p. 254 Lindem.
