(H. 4, 62 Dietsch): campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 13</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.—Absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:385" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 385</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38910.5" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">Parcarumque dies et vis inimica propinquat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et triste propinquat supplicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:493" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 493</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domui ejus ignis propinquat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turris propinquans praetoriae portae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 58</bibl>; 3, 82; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortale immortali propinquare non potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies propinquat ad vesperum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 19, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propinquus: <entryFree id="n38911" type="main" key="pro^pinquus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpinquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prope</etym>, <sense id="n38911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neighboring</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38911.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place: <cit><quote lang="la">rus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:48:4" default="NO" valid="yes">48, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium propinquus Sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propinquum praedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 13, 34</bibl></cit>: insulae propinquae inter se, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 495, 33</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in propinquis urbis montibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex propinquis itineris locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 25, 7</bibl></cit> (al. itineri). —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilium paulo propinquius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 51</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpinquum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">neighborhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicinity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex propinquo cognoscere,</quote> <trans><tr>from being in the neighborhood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 33, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex propinquo aspicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulis castra in propinquo sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 15, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38911.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38911.3" n="A" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not far off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propinqua partitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors, id. Div, 1, 30, 65: spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 25</bibl></cit>: vespera, Tac. A. <pb n="1470" /> <cb n="PROP" /> 15, 60.—</sense><sense id="n38911.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Near</hi> in resemblance, <hi rend="ital">resembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus finitimi et propinqui his animi perturbationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">significatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:16:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 16, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38911.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Near</hi> in relationship or connection, <hi rend="ital">kindred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">related</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi genere propinqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 3</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpinquus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a relation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kinsman</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">affinis, agnatus): societas propinquorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot propinqui cognatique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propinquus et amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propinqui ceteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequabiliter in longinquos, in propinquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 28, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 12, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 218</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 83</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-pinqua</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a female relative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kinswoman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo Vestalis hujus propinqua et necessaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 73</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-pinquē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard by</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">adest propinque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Anton. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Anton. 2, 2</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
propio: <entryFree id="n38912" type="main" key="pro^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n38912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>prope</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to draw near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approach</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec domibus nostris propient mala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 23, 412</bibl></cit>; in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 405</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propior: <entryFree id="n38913" type="main" key="pro^pi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĭor</orth>, <itype>ĭus</itype>, <sense id="n38913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> ōris, <hi rend="ital">adj. comp.</hi>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">proxĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. sup.</hi> (v. below, II.) [from the obsol. propis; whence prope]. </sense><sense id="n38913.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nigher.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38913.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place: <cit><quote lang="la">portus propior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut propior patriae sit fuga nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:130" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 40</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">cum propior caliginis aër Ater init oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 338</bibl></cit> (314).—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propior montem suos collocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propior hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:9" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 9</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquis ab igne propior stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propior timeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:223" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 223</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. plur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĭōra</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">places lying near</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propiora fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 168</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38913.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38913.4" n="1" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">nearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">later</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more recent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniunt inde ad propiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venio ad propiorem (epistulam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propior puero quam juveni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:53:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 53, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septimus octavo jam propior annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 15, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:42" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propiore aut longiore tempore aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:4:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38913.5" n="2" level="3"> Of relationship, <hi rend="ital">nearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more nearly related;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus propior P. Quintio nemo est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 31, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille gradu propior sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 326</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 158</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38913.6" n="3" level="3"> Of resemblance, <hi rend="ital">more nearly resembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more like</hi> (class.); with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sceleri propiora sunt, quam religioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:50:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 50, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vero est propius,</quote> <trans><tr>more probable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:801" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 801</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere Sermoni propiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 42</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">propius est fidem,</quote> <trans><tr>is more credible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tamen vitium propius virtutem erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38913.7" n="4" level="3"> Of relation or connection, <hi rend="ital">nearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more nearly related</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affecting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">concerning more nearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of greater import</hi>, <hi rend="ital">closer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more intimate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc priorem aequom'st me habere: tunica propior pallio est, proverbially,</quote> <trans><tr>my shirt is nearer than my coat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propior societas eorum, qui ejusdem civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua sibi propiora pericula esse, quam mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:18:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 18, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alium portum propiorem huic aetati videbamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnum propius medullis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura propior luctusque domesticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:578" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 578</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 9, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplemento vel Latium propius esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae quam timori propiorem cernens,</quote> <trans><tr>more inclined to anger than to fear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 9</bibl></cit>: oderat Aenean propior Saturnia Turno, <hi rend="ital">more inclined</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attached to</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 7</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">more nearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">closer</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38913.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38913.9" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius accedamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res adspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 526</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius spectare aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 67</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">stare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 361</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38913.10" n="2" level="3"> With <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">nearer to</hi>: propius grammatico accessi, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 405</bibl> P. (not elsewhere in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">propius Tiberi quam Thermopylis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius stabulis armenta tenerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 355</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38913.11" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne propius se castra moveret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars insulae, quae est propius solis occasum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 28</bibl></cit>: propius aliquem accedere,<cb n="PROP" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38913.12" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius a terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquitas quo propius aberat ab ortu et divinā progenie, hoc melius ea cernebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 25, 38, § 243</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38913.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut propius ad ea accedam, quae a te dicta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:42:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 42, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 36, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius accedo: nego esse illa testimonia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a contumeliā quam a laude propius fuerit post Vitellium eligi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam propius est factum, quam ut illum persequeretur,</quote> <trans><tr>he was within an ace of following him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 21, 59</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">propius nihil est factum, quam ut occideretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n38913.14" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">proxĭmus</orth> (PROXVMVS and PROXSVMEIS, Tab. Bant.; late <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> proximior, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 16</bibl>; Ulp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 607</bibl> P.; v. below, B. 2. and 3.; cf. in <pos>adv.</pos> 2. c.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">the nearest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38913.15" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place: <cit><quote lang="la">proxima oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 103</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">via ad gloriam proxima et quasi compendiaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad proximum mare, dein Romam pergerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proximos collis discedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 54:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 54, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximum iter in Galliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paries cum proximus ardet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri termini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 18, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximus vicinus,</quote> <trans><tr>one's nearest neighbor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 138</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15, 4</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Belgae proximi sunt Germanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: huic proximum inferiorem orbem tenet <foreign lang="greek">puro/eis</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxima Campano ponti villula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 45</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui te proximus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager proximus finem Megalopolitarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crassus proximus mare Oceanum hiemarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui proximi forte tribunal steterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 32, 12</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nearest to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dactylus proximus a postremo,</quote> <trans><tr>next before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:64:217" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 64, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque proximus ab oppresso sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximus a dominā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxima regio ab eā (urbe),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 18</bibl></cit>. —Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n38913.16" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">proxĭmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a neighbor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fellow-man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 259" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 259</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n38913.17" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">proxĭmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the neighborhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicinity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinus e proximo,</quote> <trans><tr>hard by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam hinc de proximo rogabo,</quote> <trans><tr>from the house next door</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in proximo hic sit aegra,</quote> <trans><tr>close by</tr>, <tr>next door</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic locum in proximum conduxi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fil. Fam. 16, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per impluvium huc despexi in proximum,</quote> <trans><tr>into our neighbor's</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">traicit in proxima continentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:46:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 46, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38913.18" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38913.19" n="1" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">the next preceding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">following</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the previous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the next</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the following</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ensuing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid proximā, quid superiore nocte egeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his proximis Nonis, cum in hortos Bruti venissemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gabinius quem proximis superioribus diebus acerrime oppugnasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: se proximā nocte castra moturum, <hi rend="ital">on the next</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">the following night</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximo anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 208</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proxumum annum (se) transtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximo, altero, tertio, denique reliquis consecutis diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello tanto majore quam proximo conatu apparatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 23, 6</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: IN DIEBVS V. PROXSVMEIS QVIBVS QVISQVE EORVM MAG (istratum) INIERIT, Tab. Bantin. lin. 14; so ib. lin. 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">censor qui proximus ante me fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: die proximi, old <case>abl.</case> form for proximo, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 10</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 153, 11</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crastinus, pristinus, etc., but proximo a. d. VI. Kal. Octobr.,</quote> <trans><tr>recently</tr>, <tr>last of all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 18, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38913.20" n="2" level="3"> In order of succession, rank, estimation, worth, etc., <hi rend="ital">the next</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa necessitudo videtur esse honestatis: huic proxima incolumitatis: tertia ac levissima commoditatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:58:173" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 58, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">observat L. Domitium maxime, me habet proximum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximos dentes eiciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima vulnera ... Proxima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximos illi tamen occupavit Pallas honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 19</bibl></cit>: proximum est, ut, <hi rend="ital">it follows that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remains that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the next point is</hi>: proximum <cb n="PROP" /> est ergo, ut, opus fuerit classe necne quaeramus, <hi rend="ital">we must next inquire</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 12, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximum est, ut doceam, deorum providentiā mundum administrari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:29:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 29, 73</bibl></cit>.—Of value or quality, <hi rend="ital">the next</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most nearly approaching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most like</hi> or <hi rend="ital">similar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id habendum est antiquissimum et deo proximum, quod est optimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:16:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 16, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficta voluptatis causā sint proxima veris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxima Phoebi Versibus ille facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quorum abstinentiam interrupi, modum servem et quidem abstinentiae proximiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38913.21" n="3" level="3"> In relationship, connection, or resemblance, <hi rend="ital">the nearest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most nearly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">closely related</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next of kin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most like</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">AGNATVS PROXIMVS, Fragm. XII. Tabularum: hic illi genere est proximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximus cognatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id des proximum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:16:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 16, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxima virtutibus vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propinquitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximae necessitudines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 116</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: si quis proximior cognatus nasceretur, Ulp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 607</bibl> P.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">proxĭmi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one's nearest relatives</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next of kin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriosi sunt in proximos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 14, 44</bibl></cit>; Caes. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:13:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum haec omnia cumulate tuis proximis plana fecero,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>to your friends</tr>, <tr>intimates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:64:section=165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 64, § 165</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 32, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:8:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 8, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38913.22" n="b" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">one's neighbor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fellow-man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive nostros status, sive proximorum ingenia contemplamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 2:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 2, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est mihi proximus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 118" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>; Serm. 8, 2; 90, 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n38913.23" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">That is nearest at hand</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">apt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convenient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easy</hi> (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum obvium proximumque esset dicere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:14:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 14, 12</bibl></cit>: eamus ad me; <cit><quote lang="la">ibi proximum est, ubi mutes,</quote> <trans><tr>there is the fittest</tr>, <tr>most convenient place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 64</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">proxĭmē</orth> (proxume; <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> proximius, v. below, 2. c.), <hi rend="ital">nearest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38913.24" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place, with <case>dat.</case> (not in Cic., rare in Livy): <cit><quote lang="la">quam proxime potest hostium castris castra communit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 72 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 14, 4</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum habere quam proxime hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxime Pompeium sedebam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxime Hispaniam Mauri sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 19, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Surā proxime est Philiscum oppidum Parthorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 26, 21, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes tamen quam proxime alter ab altero debent habitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38913.25" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38913.26" n="a" level="4"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">shortly before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates quae proxime bellum fecerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tito fratre suo censore, qui proximus ante me fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 12, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 39, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum proxime judices contrahentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxime abstinentiam sumendus est cibus exiguus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxime solis occasum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 9, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38913.27" n="b" level="4"> Of order, rank, estimation, condition, etc., <hi rend="ital">next to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxime et secundum deos homines hominibus maxime utiles esse possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me huic tuae virtuti proxime accedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxime a nobilissimis viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:127:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 127, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxime valent cetera lauri genera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 80, § 158</bibl></cit>: utilissimum esse omphacium; <cit><quote lang="la">proxime viride,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 4, 39, § 79</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: esse etiam debent proxime hos cari, qui, etc., Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxime morem Romanum,</quote> <trans><tr>closely following the Roman method</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 48, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat res minime certamini navali similis, proxime speciem muros oppugnantium navium,</quote> <trans><tr>closely resembling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 10</bibl></cit>.—In this sense also with <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxime atque ille aut aeque,</quote> <trans><tr>nearly the same as he</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38913.28" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Very closely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nicely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut proxime utriusque differentiam signem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 20</bibl></cit> Spald.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">analogia, quam proxime ex Graeco transferentes in Latinum proportionem vocaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne apertius, proximius, verius?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propitiabilis: <entryFree id="n38914" type="main" key="pro^pi^ti^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĭtĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>propitio</etym>, <sense id="n38914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is easy to be appeased</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propitiable</hi> (anteand post-class.): animus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 155, 31</bibl> (Com. v. 6 Vahl.); Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 14, 130.</sense></entryFree>
propitiatio: <entryFree id="n38915" type="main" key="pro^pi^ti^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĭtĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appeasing</hi>,<pb n="1471" /> <cb n="PROP" />  <hi rend="ital">atonement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propitiation</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propitiatio placatio est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Cant. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:23:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 23, 28</bibl> et saep.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse est propitiatio pro peccatis nostris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Joh. 2, 2.</sense></entryFree>
propitiator: <entryFree id="n38916" type="main" key="pro^pi^ti^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĭtĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>propitio</etym>, <sense id="n38916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a propitiator</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">habentes propitiatorem dominum nostrum Jesum Christum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 21</bibl></cit>, n. 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. prol. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propitiatorius: <entryFree id="n38917" type="main" key="pro^pi^ti^a_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĭtĭātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>propitiator</etym>, <sense id="n38917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">atoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reconciling</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">bonitas Dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Fug. Sec. 3, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĭtĭātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n38917.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A means of reconciliation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an atonement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propitiation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propitiatorium, quasi propitiationis oratorium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 4, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38917.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A place of atonement</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heb. 9, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propitiatrix: <entryFree id="n38918" type="main" key="pro^pi^ti^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĭtĭātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a propitiatress</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">delictorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Laps. Virg. 4</bibl></cit>, n. 16.</sense></entryFree>
propitietas: <entryFree id="n38919" type="gloss" key="pro^pi^ti^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĭtĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>propitius</etym>, <sense id="n38919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a state of propitiation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reconciliation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propitio: <entryFree id="n38920" type="main" key="pro^pi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (prōpĭtĭo, Ven. Fort. S. M. 4, 163; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 211), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to render favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propitiate</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.; cf. placo), Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 111, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manes Galbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:24" default="NO">4, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:50" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propitiata Juno per matronas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 40, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum genium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be propitious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propitietur vobis Dominus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:23:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 23, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38920.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to atone for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de propitiato peccato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 5, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propitius: <entryFree id="n38921" type="main" key="pro^pi^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĭtĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (prōpĭtĭus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 16, 43 al.</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prope</etym>, <sense id="n38921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well-disposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gracious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propitious</hi> (class.; cf.: faustus, prosperus, secundus). </sense><sense id="n38921.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons, esp. of deities: Mars pater, te precor quaesoque, uti sies volens, propitius mihi domo familiaeque nostrae, an old formula of prayer in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam propitiam reddam, quam cum propitia est Juno Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 112</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 164</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui homini di sunt propitii, ei non esse iratos puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita deos mihi velim propitios, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc propitium sperant, illum iratum putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti volens propitius suam sospitet progeniem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n38921.2" n="II" level="1"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">propitiis auribus accipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propitius et tranquillus Oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propius: <entryFree id="n38922" type="main" key="pro^pi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpĭus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. propior, I. <sense id="n38922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
proplasma: <entryFree id="n38923" type="greek" key="pro^plasma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏplasma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/plasma</foreign>, <sense id="n38923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pattern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">model</hi>, after which the artist fashions a thing (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 45, § 155</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 41, 4</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
propnigeum: <entryFree id="n38924" type="greek" key="pro^pni^ge_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpnĭgēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">propni/geion</foreign>, <sense id="n38924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the place before an oven</hi> or <hi rend="ital">furnace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the room where a bath was heated</hi> (pure Lat. praefurnium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propoetides: <entryFree id="n38925" type="main" key="Pro_poeti^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prōpoetĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*prwpoitides</foreign>, <sense id="n38925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Cyprian girls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having denied the divinity of Venus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">were turned to stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 220</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Placid. Fab. Ov. 10, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propola: <entryFree id="n38926" type="greek" key="pro^po_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpōla</orth> (prōpōla, Lucil. <sense id="n38926.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">propw/lhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a forestaller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a retailer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">huckster</hi> (class.): sicuti cum primus ficos propola recentes protulit, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 154, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis et vinum a propolā, atque de cupā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl></cit>.— As <pos>adj.</pos>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 731</bibl>, n. 450.</sense></entryFree>
propolis: <entryFree id="n38927" type="greek" key="pro^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/polis</foreign>, <sense id="n38927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the third foundation in making honey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gummy substance with which the bees close the crevices of their hives</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bee-glue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propolis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propolin vocant, quod apes faciunt ad foramen introitus protectum in alvum, maxime aestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima fundamenta comosin vocant periti, secunda pissoceron, tertia propolin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 7, 6, § 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:107" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 24, 50, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propolluo: <entryFree id="n38928" type="hapax" key="pro_pollu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-pollŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to defile</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pollute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 66</bibl> dub.; v. Orell. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
propoma: <entryFree id="n38929" type="greek" key="pro^po^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpŏma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/poma</foreign>, <sense id="n38929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drink taken before eating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a whet</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 32</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi> <cb n="PROP" /></sense></entryFree>
propono: <entryFree id="n38930" type="main" key="pro_po_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-pōno</orth>, <itype>pŏsŭi, pŏsĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to place before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expose to view</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to display</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38930.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">proponere vexillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallentesque manus, sanguineumque caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:9:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">i puer et citus haec aliquā propone columnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 23, 23: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid venale,</quote> <trans><tr>to expose for sale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:32:section=78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 32, § 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminum pugnae proponit honorem,</quote> <trans><tr>proposes</tr>, <tr>offers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulis diebus ediscendos fastos populo proposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem in publicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in publico epistulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 36, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalia,</quote> <trans><tr>to publish</tr>, <tr>publicly advertise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida Romanis proposita ad copiam commeatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid volucre proponeretur, praeter, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>should be served up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 50, 71, § 139</bibl></cit> (al. poneretur).—</sense><sense id="n38930.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38930.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To set before the eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to propose</hi> mentally; <hi rend="ital">to imagine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propone tibi duos reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid sibi exemplar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi aliquem ad imitandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos ante oculos animosque vestros ... Apronii regnum proponite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:23:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 23, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam (vitam) ante oculos vestros proponite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicio supplicii in bello timiditati militis proposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:46:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 46, 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">56, 154</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim fortunae animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ad scribendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38930.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To expose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus telis fortunae proposita est vita nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernis apertis proposita omnia in medio vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 25, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38930.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To point out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">represent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">say</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi>, etc. (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">indico, denuntio): ut proponat, quid dicturus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 40, 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:217" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 60, 217</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremum illud est de iis, quae proposueram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contione habitā, rem gestam proponit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exemplum proponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:27" default="NO">12, 2, 27</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Galliae Germaniaeque moribus, et quo differant eae nationes inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ante tacuerat, proponit, esse nonnullos, quorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (morbo) remedia celeria faciliaque proponebantur,</quote> <trans><tr>were proposed</tr>, <tr>suggested</tr>, <tr>believed to be efficient</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38930.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propose</hi> as a reward: <cit><quote lang="la">Xerxes praemium proposuit, qui invenisset novam voluptatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populo congiarium, militi donativum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38930.7" n="2" level="3"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to threaten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">denounce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui cum publicatio bonorum, exsilium, mors proponeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 41, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriae, quae propositae sunt a Catone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl></cit>, b, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">contentiones, quae mihi proponuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbis poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnationem et mortem sibi proponat ante oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:5:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38930.8" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lay before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to propose</hi> for an answer: aliquam quaestionem, Nep <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:20:2" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aenigma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 17, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38930.9" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">design</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consecutus id, quod animo proposuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum id mihi propositum initio non fuisset,</quote> <trans><tr>I had not proposed it to myself</tr>, <tr>had not intended it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque propositum nobis est hoc loco (laudare), etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>I am resolved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:6:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 6, 25</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositum est, non ut eloquentiam meam perspicias, sed ut,</quote> <trans><tr>the design is</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:92:318" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 92, 318</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38930.10" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To say</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mention beforehand</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38930.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To state the first premise of a syllogism</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum proponimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:39:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 39, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 40, 72</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38930.12" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To impose</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">novam mihi propono dicendi legem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Genethl. 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpŏsĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n38930.13" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A plan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">design</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quidnam Pompeius propositi aut voluntatis ad dimicandum haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assequi,</quote> <trans><tr>to attain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim propositum, ut iratum efficiat judicem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenere,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep to one's purpose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 41, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositum peragere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenax propositi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: in proposito manere. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprehendendi habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 19, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne propositum operis a nobis destinati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:19:1" default="NO">2, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:14" default="NO">12, 9, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38930.14" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The first premise of a syllogism</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:53:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 53, 215</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 8, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38930.15" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An argument</hi>: nam est in proposito<cb n="PROP" />  finis fides, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 3, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38930.16" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The main point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principal subject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theme</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a proposito declinare aliquantulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 40, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egredi a proposito ornandi causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a proposito aberrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redire ad propositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad propositum revertamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 9, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a proposito aversus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositum totius operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 65:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 65, 4 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:65:8" default="NO">65, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 68:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 68, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38930.17" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">course of life</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mutandum tibi propositum est et vitae genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:prol. 3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> prol. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir proposito sanctissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propontis: <entryFree id="n38931" type="main" key="Pro^pontis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏpontis</orth> (Prōpontis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 676</bibl>), ĭdos and <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*proponti/s</foreign>, <sense id="n38931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Propontis</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Sea of Marmora</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Hellespont and the Thracian Bosporus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:3:1" default="NO">1, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:118" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 9, 118</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n38931.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏpontĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Propontis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 21, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proporro: <entryFree id="n38932" type="main" key="pro_porro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-porro</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (Lucretian). <sense id="n38932.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">furthermore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moreover</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et, sibi proporro quae sint primordia, quaerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:979" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 979</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:890" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 890</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:312" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 312</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 140, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38932.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">altogether</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utterly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wholly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 275</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:281" default="NO" valid="yes">281</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proportio: <entryFree id="n38933" type="main" key="pro_porti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-portĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n38933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comparative relation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proportion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">symmetry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">analogy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likeness</hi> (class.): proportio, quod dicunt <foreign lang="greek">a)na/logon</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 2</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 5</bibl>: Penatis singulariter Labeo Antistius posse dici putat, quia pluraliter Penates dicantur: cum patiatur proportio etiam Penas dici, ut optimas, primas, Antias, Fest. s. v. penatis, p. 253 Müll.: id optime assequitur quae Graece <foreign lang="greek">a)nalogi/a</foreign>, Latine (audendum est enim, quoniam haec primum a nobis novantur) comparatio, proportiove dici potest, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl> and 9: <cit><quote lang="la">uti proportione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21, § 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proportionabiliter: <entryFree id="n38934" type="main" key="pro_porti^o_na_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōportĭōnābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>lengthened form of proportionaliter</etym>, <sense id="n38934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">proportionally</hi>, Boëth. 1 Geom. p. 1206.</sense></entryFree>
proportionalis: <entryFree id="n38935" type="main" key="pro_porti^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōportĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>proportio</etym>, <sense id="n38935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to proportion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proportional</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">termini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 111" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 111</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōportĭōnālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">proportionally</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Geom. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proportionalitas: <entryFree id="n38936" type="main" key="pro_porti^o_na_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōportĭōnālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>proportionalis</etym>, <sense id="n38936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">proportion</hi>, Boëth. 2 Arithm. 40.</sense></entryFree>
