proportionatus: <entryFree id="n38937" type="main" key="pro_porti^o_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōportĭōnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>proportio</etym>, <sense id="n38937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">proportioned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proportionate</hi> (postclass.): corpus, Firm. Math. 4, 13.</sense></entryFree>
propositio: <entryFree id="n38938" type="main" key="pro_po^si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpŏsĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>propono</etym>. <sense id="n38938.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A setting forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proposing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a representation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38938.1" n="A" level="2"> (Mental; <cit><quote lang="la">class.) Vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum magnarum cum animi amplā quādam propositione cogitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:163" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 163</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38938.2" n="B" level="2"> (In words.) Sunt quaedam tam breves causae, ut propositionem potius habeant quam narrationem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:7:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 1, 7, § 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38938.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A design</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositio animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:225" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 225</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38938.4" n="III" level="1"> In logic, <hi rend="ital">the first proposition</hi> of a syllogism (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">propositio est, per quem locus is breviter exponitur, ex quo vis omnis oportet emanet ratiocinationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:37:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 37, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 34, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 18, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38938.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38938.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A principal subject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theme</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38938.7" n="2" level="3"> Still more generally, <hi rend="ital">a proposition</hi> of any kind (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:47:section=9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 47, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:7:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 7, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38938.8" n="IV" level="1"> In jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">a statement</hi> of a question of law; <hi rend="ital">a case</hi> submitted for legal opinion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:19:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 1, 19, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:4:6" default="NO">36, 4, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38938.9" n="V" level="1"> Esp. in bibl. lang., <hi rend="ital">a setting forth for public view</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panes propositionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 2, 26</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
propositor: <entryFree id="n38939" type="main" key="pro_po^si^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpŏsĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proposer</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Duab. Anim. 8:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Duab. Anim. 8, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propositum: <entryFree id="n38940" type="main" key="pro_po^si^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpŏsĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. propono <sense id="n38940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
propositus: <entryFree id="n38941" type="main" key="pro_po^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from propono.</entryFree>
propraefectus: <entryFree id="n38942" type="gloss" key="pro_praefectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-praefectus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vice-prefect</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> p. 17</bibl>, n. 7.</sense></entryFree>
propraetor: <entryFree id="n38943" type="main" key="pro_praetor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-praetor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōprae-tōre</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō praetōre</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype>), <sense id="n38943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a magistrate in the times of the republic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after having administered the prœtorship one year in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was sent in the following year</hi> <pb n="1472" /> <cb n="PROP" /> <hi rend="ital">as prœtor to a province where there was no army</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a proprœtor</hi> (class.).—Form propraetor: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bella a propraetoribus administrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:36:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 36, 76</bibl></cit>.—Form pro praetore, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 103:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 103, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prorogatum Tubulo est, ut pro praetore in Etruriam succederet Calpurnio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 22, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38943.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who administers the prœtorship of a province in the absence of the prœtor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aulo fratre in castris pro praetore relicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem pro praetore in castris relictum supra diximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 37, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 25, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:66 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 66 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propriatim: <entryFree id="n38944" type="main" key="propri^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proprĭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>proprius</etym>, <sense id="n38944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">properly</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
proprie: <entryFree id="n38945" type="main" key="propri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proprĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. proprius <sense id="n38945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
proprietarius: <entryFree id="n38946" type="main" key="propri^e^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proprĭĕtārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>proprietas</etym>, <sense id="n38946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an owner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proprietor</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 15</bibl> et saep.—As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">proprietaria res,</quote> <trans><tr>belonging to one as his property</tr>, <tr>proprietary</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proprietas: <entryFree id="n38947" type="main" key="pro_^pri^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō^prĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>proprius</etym>. <sense id="n38947.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a property</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peculiarity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peculiar nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quality</hi> of a thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">singularum rerum singulae proprietates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae caelique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">definitio genere declaratur, et proprietate quādam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugum proprietates,</quote> <trans><tr>peculiar kinds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 41, § 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:31:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 31, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38947.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38947.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Ownership</hi>, <hi rend="ital">right of possession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">property</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">jumenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Salaminae insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:47" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proprietatis dominus,</quote> <trans><tr>proprietor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13:section=7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 1, 13, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:30" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:4:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 4, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38947.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">proper signification</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:21" default="NO">10, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:19" default="NO">12, 2, 19</bibl>; 1 prooem. 16; 5, 14, 34.</sense></entryFree>
propriifico: <entryFree id="n38948" type="main" key="pro_pri^i^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōprĭĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>proprius-facio</etym>, <sense id="n38948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to appropriate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make one's own</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Rustic. c. Aceph. p. 1245.</sense></entryFree>
proprio: <entryFree id="n38949" type="main" key="propri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proprĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype> (archaic form, propriassit, proprium fecerit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=229" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 229</bibl> Müll.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to appropriate</hi> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:11" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 1, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
propritim: <entryFree id="n38950" type="hapax" key="propri_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proprītim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>for propriatim from proprio</etym>, <sense id="n38950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">properly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:975" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 975</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proprius: <entryFree id="n38951" type="main" key="pro_^pri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō^prĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; perhaps from root prae; cf. prope</etym>, <sense id="n38951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not common with others</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one's own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">special</hi>, <hi rend="ital">particular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi> (class.; cf.: peculiaris, privatus). </sense><sense id="n38951.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., opp. communis: nam virtutem propriam mortalibus fecit: cetera promiscue voluit communia habere, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 361, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proprium et peculiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 25, 26, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tria praedia Capitoni propria traduntur,</quote> <trans><tr>to him for his own</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proprio sumptu edere ludos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propriā pecuniā militem juvare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">basilicam propriā pecuniā firmare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 72</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propria impensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:11:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propriis viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri, Hor S. 1, 10, 64: horreum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:C. 1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proprio Marte,</quote> <trans><tr>by his own bravery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:7:14" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">pron. poss.</hi> (class. and freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut cum ademerit nobis omnia, quae nostra erant propria, ne lucem quoque hanc, quae communis est, eripere cupiat,</quote> <trans><tr>all that belonged peculiarly to us</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suā quādam propriā, non communi oratorum facultate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 44</bibl></cit>: ut redeas ad consuetudinem vel nostram communem vel tuam solius et propriam, Luc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia qui jubet esse communia, ne quis civis propriam aut suam rem ullam queat dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 362</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis propriis periculis parere commune reliquis otium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (periculum) autem meum erat proprium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sest. 7, 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">calamitatem aut propriam suam aut temporum queri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38951.2" n="B" level="2"> Opp. alienus, etc., <hi rend="ital">one's own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peculiar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">special</hi>, <hi rend="ital">characteristic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">personal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus agendi fuit mihi magis proprium quam ceteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquae partes quales propriae sunt hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id non proprium senectutis est vitium, sed commune valetudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem propriam Romani generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proprium id Tiberio fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <trans><tr>personal resentment</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō^prĭ-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n38951.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a possession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">property</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id est cujusque proprium, quo quisque fruitur atque utitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere de proprio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:78:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 78, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38951.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="PROP" /> <hi rend="ital">characteristic mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">characteristic</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38951.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">peculiar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinary</hi>: nisi mihi fortuna proprium consilium extorsisset, Sent. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 35, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbo decreto addidit propriam ignominiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38951.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Lasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permanent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetual</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">illum amatorem tibi proprium futurum in vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 67</bibl></cit>; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 362, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil in vitā proprium mortali datum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 362:15" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 362, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui proprium atque perpetuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 16, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perenne ac proprium manere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva munera diutina, locupletia non propria esse consueverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 172</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deferens uni propriam laurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:871" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 871</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam propriam se eis daturam,</quote> <trans><tr>lasting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 32" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 32</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 284</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 2, 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 27, 3</bibl>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">proprĭē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n38951.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Specially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peculiarly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">properly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strictly for one's self</hi> (opp. communiter; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): quod me amas, est tibi commune cum multis: quod tu ipse tam amandus es, id est proprie tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promiscue toto (Campo Martio), quam proprie parvā parte frui malletis,</quote> <trans><tr>for yourselves</tr>, <tr>individually</tr>, <tr>separately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38951.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38951.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Particularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in particular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque publice neque proprie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 16, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38951.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Especially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exclusively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mira sermonis, cujus proprie studiosus fuit, elegantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:114" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 114</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:9:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 9, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38951.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Properly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strictly speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the proper</hi> (not tropical) <hi rend="ital">sense</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis proprie nihil possum dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud quidem honestum, quod proprie vereque dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:22" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti verbo proprie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:1:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:5" default="NO">2, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:11:2" default="NO">7, 11, 2</bibl>; 16, 5, 1.</sense></entryFree>
propter: <entryFree id="n38952" type="main" key="propter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">propter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>contr. for propiter, from prope; cf.: inter, subter</etym>. <sense id="n38952.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi> (syn.: prope, juxta; <cit><quote lang="la">rare but class.). serito in loco, ubi aqua propter siet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 151, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi angiportum propter est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter dormire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">araque Panchaeos exhalat propter odores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter est spelunca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl></cit> (al. prope): <cit><quote lang="la">vident unum virum esse ... et eum propter esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum duo reges propter assint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(caules) si propter sati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo filii propter cubantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 23, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentia voluptates propter intuens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 14, 48</bibl></cit>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 367, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornix propter volans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: praeter propter, v praeter. —</sense><sense id="n38952.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close to</hi> (syn.: prope, juxta, ad). </sense><sense id="n38952.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place (rare but class.); <cit><quote lang="la">stat propter virum fortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 33</bibl>: partem cohortium propter mare collocat, Sisenn ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 367, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic propter hunc assiste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: propter eam porticum situm erat dolium, Varr ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 367, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter Platonis statuam consedimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:6:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter aliquem assidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:11:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 11, 17</bibl></cit> (cited ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 367, 28</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">insulae propter Siciliam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter aquae rivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 87</bibl>.—Following its case: <cit><quote lang="la">viam propter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem propter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38952.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in stating a cause. </sense><sense id="n38952.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">On account of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by reason of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because of</hi> (syn. ob; <cit><quote lang="la">the predom. signif. of the word): parere legibus propter metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:1:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">propter metum poenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:46:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 46, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter eam ipsam causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter frigora frumenta in agris matura non erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter humanitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is propter morbum exire non potuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusato languore faucium propter quem non adesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 23, 1</bibl>: bidentes propter viam facere, <hi rend="ital">to sacrifice on account of a journey</hi>, Laber, ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 53, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">propter viam fit sacrificium quod est proficiscendi gratiā, Herculi aut Sanco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=229" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 229</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter injuriam,</quote> <trans><tr>to avoid injury</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter hoc, propter quod,</quote> <trans><tr>on that account</tr>, <tr>for which reason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 18</bibl>: propter me, te, etc., <hi rend="ital">on my</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thy account</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">as far as I</hi> (<hi rend="ital">you</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">are concerned</hi>, = mea causā, or per <cb n="PROP" /> me: <cit><quote lang="la">egon propter me illam decipi miseram sinam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est aequom me propter vos decipi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di numquam propter me de caelo descendent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 18, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38952.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by means of</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n38952.6" n="a" level="4"> Referring to persons in whom lies the cause of a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">te propter tuam Matrem non posse habere hanc uxorem domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter quos vivit,</quote> <trans><tr>through whom he lives</tr>, <tr>to whom he owes life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:22:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 22, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lugere eum, propter quem ceteri laetarentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 30, 81</bibl></cit>; 34, 93.—</sense><sense id="n38952.7" n="b" level="4"> To things by means of which any thing takes place: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim refert, utrum propter oves, an propter aves fructus capias?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Placed after its case: quod propter studi, um cum rem neglegere familiarem videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 7, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suctum propter lactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 40, 56, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam propter tantos potui perferre labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 177</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propterea: <entryFree id="n38953" type="main" key="propte^re^a_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proptĕrĕā</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>propter-is</etym>, <sense id="n38953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">therefore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for that cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on that account</hi> (syn.: ideo, idcirco, inde; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): quia mihi natalis est dies, propterea te vocari ad cenam volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propterea ... quia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div 1, 14, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 22, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec propterea de me dixi, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propterea quoniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propterea, quod,</quote> <trans><tr>because that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 1</bibl>.—Esp. with reference to something just said: <cit><quote lang="la">scio, Et pol propterea magis nunc ignosco tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id propterea nunc hunc venientem sequor,</quote> <trans><tr>with that in view</tr>, <tr>therefore</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo propterea... ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proptosis: <entryFree id="n38954" type="greek" key="propto_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proptōsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/ptwsis</foreign>, <sense id="n38954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prolapse</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propudianus: <entryFree id="n38955" type="gloss" key="pro_pu^di^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpŭdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>propudium</etym>, <sense id="n38955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">offered on account of infamous deeds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propudianus porcus dictus est, ut ait Capito Atteius, qui in sacrificio gentis Claudiae velut piamentum et exsolutio omnis contractae religionis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=238" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 238</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
propudiosus: <entryFree id="n38956" type="main" key="pro_^pu^di^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō^pŭdĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shameful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgraceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamous</hi> (ante- and postclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:7:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancilla propudiosissima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concubitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretrices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 229, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propudium: <entryFree id="n38957" type="main" key="pro_^pu^di^um1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō^pŭdĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pro-pudet</etym>. <sense id="n38957.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A shameful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">infamous action</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">propudium dicebant, cum maledicto nudare turpitudinem volebant, quasi porro pudendum. Quidam propudium putant dici, a quo pudor et pudicitia procul sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=227" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 227</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">propudii aliquem insimulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc cinere poto propudia virorum inhiberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 32, § 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38957.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">a shameful person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile wretch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rascal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">villain</hi>, a term of abuse (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid ais, propudium?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 1, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propudium illud et portentum L. Antonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; App M. 8, p. 215, 15.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38958" type="main" key="pro_^pu^di^um2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō^pŭdĭum</orth>, a dub. reading: <sense id="n38958.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">moraris tanquam propudium ignores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 99</bibl></cit>; perh. <hi rend="ital">a signal to set sail</hi> (Bücheler), or a vulgar form for propediem.</sense></entryFree>
propugnaculum: <entryFree id="n38959" type="main" key="pro_pugna_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpugnācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>propugno</etym>, <sense id="n38959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bulwark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rampart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defence</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38959.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontes et propugnacula jungunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 170</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siciliae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the fleet</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 80</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">186: solidati muri, propugnacula addita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ships furnished with towers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:2" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">armatae classes imponunt sibi turrium propugnacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppositum barbaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus ut propugnacula habeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: propugnacula aequoris, <hi rend="ital">dams</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dikes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:101" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cremona propugnaculum adversus Gallos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38959.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bulwark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defence</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lex Aelia et Fufia propugnacula tranquillitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:16:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 16, § 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannidis propugnacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:47" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propugnatio: <entryFree id="n38960" type="main" key="pro_pugna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpugnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n38960.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fighting for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defence of</hi> a place (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ect.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n38960.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vindication</hi> (class.): with the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propugnatio ac defensio dignitatis tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: propugnatio pro ornamentis <pb n="1473" /> <cb n="PROQ" /> tuis, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne mea propugnatio ei potissimum defuisse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propugnator: <entryFree id="n38961" type="main" key="pro_pugna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-pugnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>propugno</etym>, <sense id="n38961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who fights in defence</hi> of a place, <hi rend="ital">a defender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soldier</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38961.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis inops propter dimissionem propugnatorum,</quote> <trans><tr>of the marines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:33:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 33, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a propugnatoribus relictus locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudati propugnatoribus muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 6, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38961.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a defender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">champion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paterni juris defensor, et quasi patrimonii propugnator sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunarum mearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuno plebis auctorem se propugnatoremque praestitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">An epithet of Jupiter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 300, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propugnatrix: <entryFree id="n38962" type="gloss" key="pro_pugna_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpugnātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>propugnator</etym>, <sense id="n38962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that defends</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a protectress</hi>: PROPVGNATRIX MEORVM PERICVLORVM, Inscr. Marin. Iscriz. Alb. p. 136.</sense></entryFree>
propugno: <entryFree id="n38963" type="main" key="pro_pugno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-pugno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n38963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38963.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To rush out to fight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go forth to fight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make sallies</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sorties</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi ex silvis rari propugnabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl>. 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38963.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contend for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to defend</hi> a thing (class.; syn.: tutor, defendo). </sense><sense id="n38963.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno tempore propugnare et munire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro suo partu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos e muris propugnantes hastā transfixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38963.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">propugnare fratri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 234, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puero misello,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, p. 200, 13.—</sense><sense id="n38963.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro aequitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro salute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> (post-Aug.), <hi rend="ital">to defend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">absentiam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum quae libidine deliquerant, ambitu propugnant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora parmā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2</bibl></cit>. 584; 4, 110.</sense></entryFree>
propulsatio: <entryFree id="n38964" type="main" key="pro_pulsa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpulsātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>propulso</etym>, <sense id="n38964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a driving back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a keeping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">warding off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a repelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repulse</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: criminis, Tiro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propulsator: <entryFree id="n38965" type="main" key="pro_pulsa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpulsātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that drives back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a warder off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">averter</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">propulsatorem odio insecutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:8:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinum pessimarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 249</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propulso: <entryFree id="n38966" type="main" key="pro_pulso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpulso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>propello</etym>, <sense id="n38966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ward off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to repel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repulse</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38966.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum ab ingressione fori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et aquas hiemis et vapores aestatis propulsare radicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:15:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 15, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:3" default="NO">7, 12, 3</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi resistere ac propulsare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 51:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 51, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38966.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to ward off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus, famem propulsare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:25:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 25, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum capitis legum praesidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:52:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 52, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicionem a se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:60:section=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 60, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum ab urbe ac moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:44" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbos exquisitis remediis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violentiam vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidio vim propulsaturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:8:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propulsor: <entryFree id="n38967" type="main" key="pro_pulsor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpulsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that wards off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drives back</hi> (post-class.): cornigeri pecudis, Venant. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:301" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 301</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propulsus: <entryFree id="n38968" type="main" key="pro_pulsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from propello.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38969" type="main" key="pro_pulsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōpulsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (only in <sense id="n38969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>propello</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a driving on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propulsion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impulse</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ventum propulsu suo concitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:14:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
propungo: <entryFree id="n38970" type="main" key="pro_pungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-pungo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puncture in front</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tum partium propungentibus pilis capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1</bibl></cit> dub. (al. tum praerasis prominentibus pilis, capiti).</sense></entryFree>
propurgo: <entryFree id="n38971" type="gloss" key="pro_purgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-purgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cleanse beforehand</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 120</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 7, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
propylaeum: <entryFree id="n38972" type="greek" key="pro^py^laeum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpylaeum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-laeon</orth>), or <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏpy-lon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">propu/laion</foreign>, <sense id="n38972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gateway</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entrance;</hi> esp. (in <number>plur.</number>) of the celebrated entrance to the temple of Pallas in the citadel of Athens, <hi rend="ital">the Propylœum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phalereus Demetrius Periclem vituperat, quod tantam pecuniam in praeclara illa propylaea conjecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:17:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 17, 60</bibl></cit>: propylaea nobilia. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:32:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 32, 44</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Athenis propylaeon pingeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 101</bibl></cit> (al. propylon); 36, 5, 3, § 10.</sense></entryFree>
proquaestore: <entryFree id="n38973" type="main" key="pro_quaesto_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-quaestōre</orth>, <itype>or, separately</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō</orth> <cb n="PROR" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">quaestōre</orth>, <sense id="n38973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a magistrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after administering the quœstorship at Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was associated with a proconsul in the administration of a province</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a proquœstor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui et legatus et pro quaestore fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Alexandriae pro quaestore essem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—Abbreviated, Proq., Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 15, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proconsul cum quaestoribus provequaestoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 11, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proquam: <entryFree id="n38974" type="main" key="pro_quam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōquam</orth>, <itype>and, separate</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō quam</orth>, v. pro, 1.</entryFree>
proquirito: <entryFree id="n38975" type="main" key="pro_qui^ri_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-quĭrīto</orth>, no <sense id="n38975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to cry out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exclaim in public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam saepe aperiens proquiritabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 326, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex proquiritata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 6</bibl></cit>: hoc opusculum, Claud. Mam. Stat. Anim. praef. p. 33.</sense></entryFree>
prora: <entryFree id="n38976" type="greek" key="pro_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōris</orth>; <case>acc.</case> prorim, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 200, 33</bibl>, or Trag. 575), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prw/ra</foreign>. <sense id="n38976.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The forepart of a ship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the prow</hi> (opp. puppis, the stern; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): astitit prorae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 554</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prorae admodum erectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rostrata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 49, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terris advertere proram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 35</bibl>: prorae tutela Melanthus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the lookout stationed at the prow</hi>, = proreta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 617</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensa prora navim in puppim statuebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prorae litore illisae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:1082" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 1082</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:335" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 335</bibl>.—Prov.: mihi prora et puppis, ut Graecorum proverbium est, fuit a me tui dimittendi, ut rationes nostras explicares, i. e. <hi rend="ital">my intention from beginning to end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">my whole design</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">prw/ra kai\ pru/mnh</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 24, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38976.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">a ship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot prius aeratae steterant ad litora prorae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 223</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prorepo: <entryFree id="n38977" type="main" key="pro_re_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-rēpo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to creep forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crawl out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come out</hi> in a gradual or unobserved manner (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n38977.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(formica) non usquam prorepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum prorepserunt primis animalia terris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochleae prorepunt e cavis terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 39, 59, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegri quoque ad conspectum tui prorepere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:22:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 22, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38977.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38977.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To creep along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crawl forwards</hi> to a place: <cit><quote lang="la">rumore caedis exterritus prorepsit ad solarium proximum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38977.4" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate subjects, <hi rend="ital">to come forth gradually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ooze out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exude</hi>, of the vine: <cit><quote lang="la">prorepentes oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:38" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:3" default="NO">3, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pampinus e duro prorepsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardaque sudanti prorepunt balsama ligno, Claud. Nupt. Honor. et Mar. 96: ne palmites libero excursu in luxuriam prorepant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor lente prorepit,</quote> <trans><tr>gradually flows off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:16:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervus prorepit usque ad ultimam partem caudae,</quote> <trans><tr>extends</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 12, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proreta: <entryFree id="n38978" type="greek" key="pro_re_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōrēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prwra/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n38978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lookout man at the prow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the under-pilot</hi> (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si tu proreta isti navi es, ego gubernator ero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proreus: <entryFree id="n38979" type="greek" key="pro_reus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōreus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prwreu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n38979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lookout man at the prow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under-pilot</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 634</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proriga: <entryFree id="n38980" type="main" key="pro_ri^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōrĭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prob. pro-rego</etym>, <sense id="n38980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stable-boy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an attendant employed in breeding horses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 64, § 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proripio: <entryFree id="n38981" type="main" key="pro_ri^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-rĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>pŭi, reptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n38981.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To drag</hi> or <hi rend="ital">snatch forth</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38981.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem proripi jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:62:section=161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 62, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudos pedes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>spring forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 82</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rush out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hurry forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo illum hunc hominem proripuisse foras se dicam ex aedibus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex curiā repente proripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex curiā domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se porta foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (12 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>); <cit><quote lang="la">1, 80: se domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex totā urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38981.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae libido non se proripiet ac proiciet occultatione propositā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38981.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To snatch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hurry on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forwards</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">away.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38981.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in publicum,</quote> <trans><tr>to rush into the street</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in silvam,</quote> <trans><tr>to take refuge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se custodibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se cursu,</quote> <trans><tr>to run away</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 196, 15</bibl></cit>.—Without <hi rend="ital">se</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quo deinde ruis? quo proripis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 741</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38981.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ne virilis Cultus in caedem, et Lycias proriperet catervas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 16</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PROR" /></sense></entryFree>
proris: <entryFree id="n38982" type="main" key="pro_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōris</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. prora.</entryFree>
prorito: <entryFree id="n38983" type="main" key="pro_ri_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-rīto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>like ir-rito, āre; cf. also ira</etym>. <sense id="n38983.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To provoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">produce by irritation</hi> (post - Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 58, § 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38983.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tempt</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nisi pretium proritat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem spes proritat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 23:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proritat illos rei species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 12:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum varietate aptā ciborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 104" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad furias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 178</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prorogatio: <entryFree id="n38984" type="main" key="pro_ro^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōrŏgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prorogo</etym>. <sense id="n38984.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A prolonging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extension</hi> of a term of office: <cit><quote lang="la">prorogatio imperii,</quote> <trans><tr>a prolongation of one's command</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n38984.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A putting off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deferring</hi> of an appointed time: <cit><quote lang="la">diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 43</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 23, 47</bibl>, the true reading is perrogationem; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 30, 9</bibl>, propagatio).</sense></entryFree>
prorogativus: <entryFree id="n38985" type="main" key="pro_ro^ga_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōrŏgātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">admitting of delay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prorogative</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">prorogativa fulmina sunt, quorum minae differri possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:47" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
prorogator: <entryFree id="n38986" type="main" key="pro_ro^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōrŏgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that pays</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gives out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dispenser</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tritici, vini, et olei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 10, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prorogo: <entryFree id="n38987" type="main" key="pro_ro^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-rŏgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n38987.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To prolong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protract</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: propago, produco): ne quinquennii imperium Caesari prorogaretur,</quote> <trans><tr>should not be prolonged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid temporis nobis prorogetur (in the province),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium in insequentem annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 42, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 22, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium praeturae in alterum annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem militi in alium diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moras in hiemes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 22, 34, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 31, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis famam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 9:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 19, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38987.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38987.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To keep for a long time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to preserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">divinis condimentis utere, quī prorogare vitam possis hominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum in lustrum, meliusque semper Proroget aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:67" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C.
